 He is 37, married, has 3 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporary on front line in Fizuli region.  
Having borrowed a loan of $800 he bought foodstuffs.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 2 refrigerating equipments and to do jobbing in his own store.

Babek has a small shop where he sells rubbers. He started off working by selling as a retailer. 
He saved enough money to set up a business . 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought rubbers, rubber shoes.
For the second  time he borrowed a loan of $600 to open  a shoe store.
Now he needs a loan of $850 to buy leather shoes. He wants to improve his business. 
Babek is 37, married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled  on front line in Fizuli region Akhmedbeyli village.

Djamil is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had this business for 6 years. He enjoyes looking after calves. He plans o open a shop and o sale of meat. 
Having borrowed a loan of $800 he bought 4 calves and fattened.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to open a shop for sale meat.
Djamil is 38, married, has a child, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporary on front line in Fizuli region.

Maksad has been selling clothes for  4 years. Although his business is profitable, it does not always provide enough for him and his family. He decided to borrow  a loan of $400 to buy boots,  jackets for women and children.\r\nHe lives with his  family in Fizuli region. \r\nNow he needs a loan of $850 to start sale of manufactured goods.

Telman is married, has 3 children, , Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled  on front line in Fizuli region Makhmudlu 1 village. He has his own bee-garden.
He is well known beekeeper in his village. All people praises his honey.
In he beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought (bee)hives.
The second loan  of $700 he spent to buy  cases. 
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy package for packing honey.

Timothy is the father of five children and seven grandchildren. His dream is to build a house from which he can collect rents when he becomes old and tired and cannot continue with labor-intensive business. Having received training in pig farming, shoe-mending, marketing techniques and credit management organized by GHAPE, he has borrowed and repaid three cycles of loans of $40, $100 and $120  since 2003. He succeeded in rendering shoe repair services and providing manure for cultivation and meat to his community.

Given a loan of $400, he plans to buy 2 truck loads of firewood and sell it for cooking and heating; buy materials to enlarge his pig sty to produce additional manure and meat for farmers and consumers in the community; buy a hoe and cutlass yam seeds to cultivate for increased carbohydrate supply in the local markets; and tools to repair shoes. 

He is capable of handling the loan and repaying without difficulties given his previous credit history and achievements from profits on previous loans. He plans to pay his loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

Gilbert is the father of six children and two grandchildren from his oldest daughter. As he struggles to deal with the bitter truth of missing and incarcerated sons, Gilbert is determined to maximize his acquired skills. From his three previous loans he provided manure for farmers and carpentry services such as repairing broken windows, changing door locks, and constructing chairs for community members.

Given a loan of $600, he plans to buy planks, nails, and zinc to expand his piggery, and vegetable seeds to cultivate. He will provide manure and meat and employment for young kids who will supply grass for his pigs. His business will keep his children and other young kids out of crime.

Gilbert is capable of handling the loan money and repaying it without problems. He plans to pay his loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

Emin breeds  calves in a private farm shed. He runs this business for 4 years.
In he beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 to buy fodder, grass.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves or expand his business.
Emin is 27, married,has a child, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporary on front line in Fizuli region.

Elizabeth is a married mother of five surviving children out of seven. Her immediate goal is to provide health care for her family. She received training in pig farming, business techniques, and credit management organized by GHAPE, and has been having continuous training from experience-sharing at center meetings and on-the-spot supervision by group members. From her three previous loans she succeeded in providing 20 liters of manure daily and at least 1 pig every three months for meat in her community.

With a loan of $600 she plans to enlarge her farm by buying sticks to increase the size of the fence, adding piglets and buying pig-feed, renting farm-land and buying seeds. She will supply manure  (demand for organic manure far outweighs the supply in her community) and meat for food. 

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

Theresia (fondly called Mami-Koki) is a widow with seven children. Getting her children through school is her dream. She has received training in making koki (bean paste served with potatoes, cassava, plantain), business techniques, credit and other survival skills. With constant supervision and support from group members she took her first loan of $40 in 2003, and two subsequent loans in 2004 and 2005. From previous investment she succeeded in providing lunch at job sites.

With a loan of $600, she plans to increase her stock by buying a size-10 pot, a bag of beans, a drum of oil and plates. This mobile food selling will provide lunch, especially to manual laborers, at job sites in the community.

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

Florence is a monogamist, married to Ade Marcus with six children. The death of both parents when she was still young left her with responsibilities that she was ill-prepared for. So getting younger ones and her children through school is her dream since she lost her parents. She has received training in crop cultivation, business techniques, credit and other survival skills. With constant supervision and support from group members she took her first loan of $40 in 2003, and two subsequent loans in 2004 and 2005. From previous investment she succeeded in providing lunch at job sites.

With a loan of $500, she plans to increase her stock by buying a truck load of firewood to provide dry cooking fuel to households in the community. She will also buy fertilizer, groundnut, yam, sweet yam and corn seeds. 

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first  repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

Mukhammad has a small store where he sells spare parts. He is a very kind, friendly and hard working person. He has had his business for 4 years ago and it allows him to support his family. He is 28 years old. Mukhammad is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. \r\n\r\nHe applies for a loan amount of $1000 to buy the spare parts. He is very optimistic about the future of his business.

This 37-year-old man is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had this business for 5 years and it allows him to support his family.
He likes to breed sheep. 
He is married, has 3 children and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. 
The first time he borrowed a loan of $600 and bought 8-10 lambs.
Now he applies for a loan of $850 to buy equipment for  shearing sheep. He wants to improve fleece production.

This is a 32 year old man, who is enjoying his business. He is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. 
Nazim is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan- Djabrail region. He is married, has 2 children,and is settled in Khirdalan settlement.
He has run this business for 10 years.
Having borrowed a loan amount of $500, he bought spare parts. He has a lot of plans.
Nazim works very hard to bring about his plans.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy spare parts and a compressor.

This 39-year-old man was born in Makhmudlu village in the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan.
He is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. 
He is married and has 4 children.
Marx has had his business for 8 years and it allows him to support his family. Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought powder, soaps, sweets.Now he applies for a loan of $1000 to begin sale of foodstuffs.

This hard-working person has 30 head of cattle. He has difficulty in tending a herd in the pasture because he does not have a horse. 
Having borrowed a loan of $600 he bought 8-10 sheep and goats.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a horse.
He has had this business for 8 years and it allows him to support  his family.
He is 39, married, has 3 children and is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region.

Sadiyar has sold agricultural produce: potatoes, onions for 5 years. He can not increase produce because his shop is too small.\r\nNow he needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of his shop in order o buy a lot of agricultural produce.\r\nHe is 35,an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, is married, has a child.

Safa and his brother Vafadar like this business. They are Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, Veyselli village, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region.\r\nOne day they decided to borrow a loan of $600 in order to buy new sort seedlings.\r\nNow they need a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer.

Sarvan was born in 1980 in the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan. He is married and  has 2 children. \r\nHaving borrowed a loan amount of $600 he bought shoes and socks. \r\nNow he needs a loan of $1000 to buy clothes.

Seyyad has a small business where he sells home products. 
He is 37, married and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. 
Having borrowed a loan of $800 he repaired his shop.
Now he applies for a loan of $1000 to buy CDs, DVDs and video players.

28-year-old Shakhla is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbacar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement.\r\nShe previously borrowed $400 and bought perfumes. Now she needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of her shop.

Bahar has been engaged in this business for 5 years. She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city. She is 40, has 2 children. She has his own mini shop. This 40-year-old woman is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from Normicro she rented the grocery store and bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc. \r\nNow Bahar wants loan amount of  $1500 to increase the range of goods and to buy the refrigerator.

Helal was born in Lachin region of Azerbaijan. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP). He settled with his family and 2 children in Sumgait. Difficulties of life forced them to start the business. He is 30. He is the only breadwinner in the family. In the beginning he used to sell vegetables. By borrowing the loan amount of $800 he has bought refrigerator and has increased the range of fruits.\r\n\r\nHelal applies for $1200. He plans to be busy with sale agricultural products.

Gozal is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city. She is 36. She vidow and has 3 children. Gozal has lost the husband. Not looking all difficulties in current of 9 years this mother has grown up the children lonely. 3 year ago she rented the mini market and has bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc.\r\nNow Gozal wants loan amount of $1000 to build her own food market and to buy the new refrigerator.

Ofelia is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Sumgait city, has 3 children. This 46-year-old woman has been engaged in her business for 8 years. Ofelia sells women’s clothes. She supports her family with this business. \r\nNow she needs a loan amount of $2000 to be busy with selling the street clothes and industrial goods.

Salman is an Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. This 62-year-old began his business at 22 years old. In the beginning of his business he sold bags. Having borrowed the loan $500 he bought the 60 pair of shoes and began to sell them. Now Salman has rented a retail space for his shoe shop and he needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of a shop and to increase the range of shoes for sale.

Efren is a very industrious and enthusiastic man in spite of the difficulties he has had to endure. Some years ago he had an accident. Because of that he is confined to a wheelchair, thus he has not been able to work as he used to before. Then his wife became pregnant and was also unable to work. Nevertheless, he began to sell packaged duritos and chips. Thanks to this he has been able to take care of his wife and 3 small children.

Now he needs a loan of $200 in order to buy materials to roof the premises in order to keep his business going as it has up to now. Your help is very valuable, have no doubts about it.

Please support Efren and his family. They will be sincerely grateful.

Lorena lives in the area of San Juanito Chihuahua and is a mother of three sons all of a young age. Her current husband work in EUA and is a mechanic. A few years ago she began a clothing sales store, because her ex husband took her children away, arguing that she did not have the funds to support her children. This led her to work very hard day after day in order to be able to reclaim her sons. Today, they are living with her again, thanks to the work she developed. Her business also allowed her to settle home expenditures. She has proven herself to be a very strong entrepreneur.

At this time Lorena is requesting a loan of $975 in order to buy more merchandise and expand the sales of her business. She and her family need your generosity, the decision is in your hands. She and her family would always be thankful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena vive en la localidad de San Juanito Chihuahua es madre de tres hijos aún menores de edad, su actual esposo trabaja en EUA en un taller mecánico. Ella hace algunos años comenzó con un negocio de venta de ropa, pues su ex esposo se llevo a sus hijos argumentando que ella no tenía ingresos para sostenerlos. Esto la impulsó a luchar y trabajar arduamente día a día para poder recuperar a sus hijos. Ahora están con ella de nuevo, gracias a la actividad que ella desarrolla y también ha podido a su actual pareja a solventar los gastos del hogar. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy emprendedora y fuerte.

Actualmente Lorena requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de 975 dlls para poder comprar más mercancía y aumentar las ventas de su negocio. Ella y su familia necesitan de tu generosidad, la decisión esta en tus manos. Ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer siempre.

Caritina is a woman who, throughout her life, worked very hard in order to provide for her six sons. She is a single mother. Throughout this time she dedicated herself to selling beauty products/cosmetics, which allowed her to settle all expenses. Today she has the added responsibility of taking care of a niece who is an orphan. This is why she is now struggling for more each day.

In this moment she needs a loan of $650, which she plans to return in approximately 6 to 12 months. She will use this money to buy merchandise in order to offer more products to her clients and expand her business. Do not doubt her, she and her neice need your support and they thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Caritina es una mujer que durante toda su vida ha trabajado arduamente por sacar adelante a sus seis hijos, ya que es madre soltera. Durante todo este tiempo se ha dedicado a vender productos de belleza y con esta actividad ella ha podido solventar todos los gastos. Ahora también ella tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a una nieta que se quedó huérfana. Es por eso que ahora lucha más cada día.

En este momento ella necesita de un préstamo de 650 dlls, mismos que planea regresar en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses aproximadamente. Y que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder tener más surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos. No lo dudes más, ella y su nieta necesitan de tu apoyo y te lo agradecen.

Yolanda is a single mother of three sons and lives in the area of San Juanito, in the state of Chihuahua. She has been dedicating herself to selling sweets from her home for the last few years, since her sons were very little. She did not have any money and struggled through very economically difficult moments, and did not have anybody to look after her sons. For these reasons she began her little business. Her business grew little by little with her large effort, dedicated and the unconditional support from her sons.

In order for her business to continue growing as it has been, she needs a loan of $325, which she will use to buy merchandise and increase supplies and therefore sales. Yolanda needs your support and thanks you sincerely for it.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es madre soltera de 3 hijos y viven en la localidad de San Juanito, en el estado de Chihuahua. Ella desde hace tiempo se dedica a la venta de dulces en su propio domicilio, pues hace mucho años, cuando sus hijos eran muy pequeñitos, ella no tenía dinero y atravesaba por momentos muy difíciles económicamente, y no tenía quien le cuidara a los niños, es por todas estas circunstancias por las que comenzó con este pequeño negocio. Mismo que ha ido creciendo poco a poco con su esfuerzo, dedicación y el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos.

Para poder seguir creciendo y continuar como hasta ahora, ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de 325 dlls, mismos que destinará a la compara de más mercancía que incremente el surtido y de esta manera sus ventas. Yolanda necesita de tu apoyo y te lo agradece sinceramente.

Don José Dolores is the father of a family with six sons, living in the area of San Juanito, in the state of Chihuahua. Many years ago he began a small business selling groceries from his own home, with the support of his wife. With the time the business has grown little by little. Thanks to the activity of his store he has been able to pay for the education of his sons, which would have otherwise been impossible.

At this moment he is asking for a loan of $475 in order to purchase more merchandise and in this way attract more clients. Do not doubt him, you have the possibility to help Jose Dolores and his family, and they would be sincerely thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Don José Dolores es padre de familia, de 6 hijos, ellos viven en la localidad de San Juanito, en el estado de Chihuahua. Hace muchos años el comenzó con un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes en su propio domicilio, con el apoyo activo de su esposa. Con el paso de tiempo ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido solventar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos, que de otra forma no hubiera sido posible.

En este momento el requiere de un préstamo de 475 dlls para poder comprar más mercancía y de esta manera atraer a más clientes. No lo dudes más, tú tienes la posibilidad de ayudar a José Dolores y a su familia, ellos agradecen tu apoyo sinceramente.

Dorcas is a single mother of two children in primary school. She started her business in 2004 after separating from her husband. She received her initial capital from the proceeds of her tobacco harvest. With her first loan of $143 from PEMCI, she has increased her stock in order to improve her income and broaden her capital base in the business. The income generated from the business is used to support her family, especially the children.

Patrick is married with seven children. His wife is a small-scale farmer. Patrick finished his secondary school and then went to a training institute. After starting his business four years ago, he is able to support his family through his business. With a loan of US$100 from PEMCI, he will be able to boost his stock in order to improve his income and broaden his capital base in the business. His business is now sufficient enough to accommodate customer’s needs.

Rose is married with four children, two of them in primary school. She started her shop business two years ago after selling her tobacco harvest. She started the shop in order to supplement her husband’s income. The shop is doing well and with the loan of US$150 from PEMCI she intends to build up her stock and improve profitability. She wants to quit the tobacco growing business due to its health hazards.

Basil is married with three children, one in primary school and two not yet in school. He started his business in 1998, with capital of Ksh.5000 from the sale of his farm produce. This was not enough so he had to sell his next harvest in order to increase his stock. With a loan from PEMCI, Basil intends to convert his shop to a wholesale business so as to meet the demands of other shopkeepers in the surrounding area. Those shopkeepers currently must travel long distances in order to get their stock.

Tahirov O. is a butcher in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Tahirov is married with 2 children. His wife works as a house wife raising the children. Finding employment is Azerbaijan, where the unemployment rate is very high, is currently very difficult. Tahirov is a small business owner who needs access to capital in order to invest in his business so that his business can continue to grow and prosper.

Isa is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region. He relocated to Sumgayit city with his wife and one child. He has owned his butcher shop for the past seven years. Isa is applying for a loan to increase the amount of goods at his shop as well as to purchase new scales.

6 years ago Bibi decided to buy plot of land and to become a wine-grower. She now has a vineyard. 
This 57-year-old woman likes her business. She irrigates and cultivates the plot of land.
Bibi lives with her 6 children in Yenikand village,Salyan region,Azerbaijan.
She requires a loan of $600 with which she plans to buy fertilizer.

Famila was born in 1945 in Khaladj village, Salyan region, Azebaijan .She is married has 4 children. She is a role model to many young women. \r\nWhen she was young she liked to look after cattle with her parents. \r\nShe applies for a loan of $1000 to buy 4 pedigree cows.

Vidadi is an IDP from armenian occupied district of Fizuli since 1993. In 1998 he started his trading business in Baku city. In 2000-2006 he borrowed five loans from Normicro Baku branch and expanded his business volume. Now he wants to borrow 1000$ to increase variety of goods.

Makhluga has her own plot of land. You can see in the picture her vineyard. She has been farming for 8 years.\r\nShe lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village Makhluga is married has 2 children and  is 47.\r\nMakhluga needs a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

Bakhsheish is IDP from armenian occupied district of Lachin since 1993. In 1999 he started his trading business in Baku city. in 2000-2006 he borrowed five loans from Normicro Baku branch amounting 1800$ in total and expanded in merchandise opportunity. Now he wants to borrow 1000$ to buy a variety of goods.

Baloglan has a small business where he sell fruits and vegetables. He started off working by selling  as a street vendor.
He is 41, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, Makhmudlu village, settled in Fizuli region Seyidmahmudlu village. He is married and has 3 children.
He applies for a loan of $1000 to buy a store.
He has had this business for 6 years.

This 37-year-old man is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, Karakhanbeyli village. He settled in the Kayidish village, Fizuli region. He is married and has 2 children. He runs a small business selling clothes for men and women. He has been in the clothing business for over 5 years. His diligent, hard work has helped him to succeed in business.\r\nHe has rented a small shop in a fair.Now he needs a loan of $800 o buy this shop.

Devran is an IDP from armenian occupied district of Lachin since 1993. In 1997 he started his trading business in Baku city. In 2001-2006 he borrowed  three loans from Normicro Baku branch 200$, 300$, 400$ and expanded his business volume. Now he wants to borrow 500$ to expand his business.

This 52-year-old dairy woman has been in this business for 10 years. She is married and has 4 children, lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region . This business is the sole provider for her family’s livelhood.\r\nThrough her experience, Makhira has gained a great deal of knowledge and skills to improve her business.\r\nShe requests a loan of $800 to buy 2 milk cows.

Suleyman is an IDP from Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. In 1999 he started his private business in Baku with his own resources. \r\nIn 2004-2006 he borrowed 2 loans from Normicro Baku branch and used it for business expansion. Now he borrows 800$ to expand his business further to be able to cover all his family expenditures.

Rashid H. owns an Audio/Video store in the town of Khachmaz in North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Rashid is one of Azerbaijan’s new young entrepreneurs. Rashid wants to increase the number of customers that come to his store by increasing and diversifying his inventory.

Shovle K. has a computer salon in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Shovle is one of Azerbaijan’s increasing number of women entrepreneurs. Shovle is looking for funding so that she can purchase more computers which will allow her to increase her client base.

Latafat is an IDP from the occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. She fled from Agdam in 1993 and moved to Baku city. She started her trading business in 1999 with her own money. In 2000 she received a  Normicro loans and expanded her business slightly. Then she received more loans and strengthened her business. Now she borrows $1200 to increase the variety of her business goods .

Shamama is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. She has had her business for 6 years and it allows her to support her family.\r\nShamama is 49, married, has 3 children.She lives in the Salyan region.  She has her own a vineyard.\r\nNow she requests a loan of $800 to buy another plot of land to increase her income.

Chapay is an IDP from the Armenian occupied district of Fizuli since 1993. In 2002 he started his trading business in Baku city. In 2006 he borrowed  $300 loan from Normicro, Baku branch an expanded his business volume. Now he wants to borrow $500 to expand his business volume again.

This 47-year-old woman provides for her family with her business. She has been engaged in this business at home. She has a lot of clients.
Tahmina is a well-known laundress in Yenikand village, Salyan region . She is tidy, clean and frank. 
She tries to increase the number of her clients.
Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy a washing-machine.

Shakir is an IDP from the Armenian occupied district of Fizuli since 1993. In 2004 he started his service business in Baku city. In 2006 he borrowed $500  from Normicro, Baku branch and bought some equipment for his business. Now he wants to borrow $700 to buy more equipment for his barber shop.

Djamaladdin is a very strong and hard-working person. 
10 years ago he started his own business. 
He has put in much effort to make his café one of the most popular cafes in Khaladj village. He has a lot of regular clients. Many come to his café to forget their problems.
He needs a loan of $1000 to buy tables, glasses and other necessary things for cafe.

Aynure O. owns a school supply / Stationary store in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. She is another one of Azerbaijan’s growing number of young women entrepreneurs. Aynure is looking for funding so that she can increase the quantity and diversity of her store inventory.

Zaur is a very active and responsible man. 5 years ago he decided to start a small business. This business has allowed his family to have a better income. He is 25, married, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. The first time he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought agricultural produce.
The second time he borrowed $1000 and bought scales and  made shelves.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to expand the area of his place in the market.
Zaur has sold agricultural produce in the Khirdalan market for 5 years.

Tebib was born in 1975 in Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has a child. 

Tebib has been running this business for 3 years.  He is very happy with his business, works hard every day to give the best service to his customers, and to keep his store well-supplied so they will always find the product they want.
Having borrowed $600, he increased the variety of products available in his store.
Now he needs a loan amount of $1000 to buy a refrigerator.

Sedaget F. has recently opened a new internet café in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. She is another one of Azerbaijan’s growing number of young women entrepreneurs. Sedaget is looking for funding so that she can purchase new computers to serve a growing client base.

Durdana supplies milk in Khaladj village, Salyan region, where she lives with her 3 children . With this business she meets the demands of her family. She has been in this business for 4 years. She has a milk cow. \r\nDurdana plans to increase her production by buying a lot of milk cows to improve her dairy farm. Her cows provide her income and also provide milk for her family.\r\nShe requests a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.

Semerder M. owns a small local market in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Semeder is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and quality of products he supplies to his customers.

Aslan is an IDP from Khojavend region. He has been a client of Normicro since 2003. First he borrowed $400 and started his business selling mobile phones and accessories. Thus he established a business where he earns his living. Now his business is developing and he needs funding to expand his business.

Sovkat is a low income person from the Agsu district. She started her business in 2002. In 2003 she borrowed $200 from Normicro Agsu branch and expanded her business. In 2005 she borrowed $300 from Normicro. Now she wants to borrow $1000 to increase the variety of her goods.

A. is an IDP from the occupied Fizuli district since 1993. In 2003 he started his trading business in Baku city. In 2006 he borrowed his first loan from Normicro, Baku branch and increased the variety of goods. Now he asks for a loan of $1125 to increase the variety of goods.

Farman a low-income person, is originally from the Agsu district. He started his cafe in 2004. In 2005 he borrowed $300 from Normicro, Agsu branch and used it to buy equipment for his business. Now he wants to borrow another 300$ to repair his shop.

Elmira M. owns a butcher shop in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. She and her husband both operate the store on a daily basis. Elmira is looking for funding in order to purchase a cow for her business.

Ilgar is an IDP from Agdam district of Azerbaijan since 1993. In 2000 he started his private business in Baku city. In 2006 he received his first loan from Normicro, Baku branch and bought some equipment to serve clients with better quality. Now he wants to borrow $1050 to buy some equipment for his shop.

Mezahir is a low-income person from Agsu district. He opened his business 4 years ago. He borrowed his fist loan from Normicro Agsu branch in 2006 and used  it for buying some equipment for car repair and to expand the business. Now he will use this loan to buy some some materials in advance to be able to do fast repair.

Firdovsi is an IDP from the Armenian occupied district of Azerbaijan, Agdam since 1993. He started his business in 2004 with a Normicro loan of $600. He used this loan to establish this business. Now he borrows $350 to expand his business.

Yusif  is an IDP from Fizuli district of Azerbaijan since 1993. In 2001 he started his trading business in Baku city. In 2003-2006 he borrowed four loans with a total amount $2900 from Normicro, Baku branch and increased his variety of goods. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to increase the variety of goods he sells.

Elvan is a low-income person from the Agsu district. He is 48. He started his business in 2004 with aNormicro loan of $200. His second loan was $400. Now he hopes to borrow $1200 to expand the volume of his business.

Mushfig is an IDP from the Fizuli region who now resides in Beylagan region. He faced many hardships in earning a living for his family and he decided to  start a business. He borrowed $300 from Normicro and started the business of butchery. His first attempt was successful and he borrowed a second loan of $1000 from Normicro and expanded the business. Now he needs $1200 to put a counter-refrigerator in his butcher shop.

Mahammadali is an IDP from Jabrail district of Azerbaijan since 1993. In 2001 he started his private business in Baku city.  In 2004-2006 he borrowed three loans from Normicro, Baku branch which totalled $2400. Now he wants to borrow $1100 to increase the variety of goods in his store.

Anar is a young man, originally from the Agsu district. He opened his business in 2004 and in that year he borrowed $250 from Normicro and used it for establishing his business. Now he wishes to borrow $500 to buy material and sewing machine.
Taleh is a young barber from the Agsu district. He started his business last year, in 2006. Now he borrows his first loan of $550 to expand his business.

Yegane is a low-income person from the Agsu district. She is a pharmacist and she opened her shop in February 2004 with a Normicro loan. Now she borrows $500 to expand her business and do repairs in the shop

38-year-old Imameddin settled with his 2 children  in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Gubadli region. Since 2002 he has been engaged in meat sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed first $400, he significantly expanded his business amd bought 2 calves. The loans were paid back in a timely manner.\r\nNow Imameddin applies for a loan of $1200 to buy 4 calves, to expand his business.

Mehman is a low-income person from the Agsu district. He started his shop in 2001. He borrowed $600 from Normicro, Agsu branch to build the shop building. Now he borrows $1200 for buying spare parts to do fast repairs.

56-year-old Azad with his 4 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Gubadli region. Since 2002 Azad has been engaged in animal sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed 2 loans ($500; $800;) from Normicro, Azad significantly expanded his business, bought 11 sheep, achieved progress in his business and increased his family income. The loans were paid back in a timely manner.\r\nHe applies for a loan amount of $1200 to buy 12 sheep.

Arif is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He is 39 and has 2 children. He is the only breadwinner in the family. He has been engaged in this business for 8 years. He has an ability to buy the best perfumes. He is very polite with all his clients. Arif decided to apply for a loan $500 in order take advantage of the busy retail trade. The second time he borrowed t $800 and varied the perfumes. The third time he borrowed $900 in order to rent the perfume store.\r\nHe applies for a loan of $1200 to open his own perfumery and to increase the range of goods.

Ali is a low-income person from the Agsu district, Dalilar village. He started his animal breeding business in 2000. In 2005 he borrowed his first loan  of $300 from Normicro, Agsu branch. Now he borrows $600 from Normicro to expand his business.

Baylar was born in 1961 in the Shusha region of Azerbaijan. He is an internally displaced person (IDP), settled in Sumgait city. He has been working in the joiner's shop since 1991. He is a well known joiner in Sumgait city. He has 3 children. He is ahard worker. Now he wants to buy a lathe, boring mill and additional materials: mahogany and etc. He applies for the loan $1200 from KIVA.

Firudin is a resident of Sumgayit city. He is 51 years old and has four children. He started his business of selling household goods seven years ago. Firudin applies for a loan to expand his business and increase the amount of inventory available.

Elbrus runs a small clothing business selling imported clothes from Turkey. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli, relocated to Sumgayit city. He started his business seven years ago and the business is doing well. He now requests a loan to offer a greater variety of items to attract more customers.

Agamammad was born in the Guba region of Azerbaijan. He settled in Sumgait city. He has been busy with copper-plate engraving. Every morning he collects yellow copper from a brass plant. Having borrowed  $400 from Normicro he has bought a dresser and different instruments. The second loan  of $800 he spent to increase his business.\r\nAgamammad applies for loan $1200 to expand his business area.

Arzu and her family  have settled in Sumgait city. She is 36 year old, an Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli. \r\nHaving borrowed $300 she bought a sewing machine. She has been engaged in this business at her own home for 14 years. After buying the sewing machine she thought that it is time to start a business, but she did not have enough money. The second time she borrowed $500 to sew on a machine genuine leather jackets, genuine leather clothes for women. She  does not have a tailor shop. She has a lot of clients but her home is not comfortable for her business.  \r\nArzu needs a loan of $850 to open her own tailor shop.

Yelmar was born in 1959 in Gubadli region of Azerbaijan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) who resettled in Sumgayit city 14 years ago. He was married, but lost his wife during the war. When he started his business six years ago, he bought goods to re-sell. Now he sells cigarettes and other retail goods at the bazaar. Yelmar is requesting a loan to increase the  assortment and variety of goods he sells.

Mubariz is low income resident of Beylagan town. He has established his own business to sustain his family. He has a tailor shop. First he borrowed a loan from Normicro, Beylagan office in the amount of $600 to buy materials and to expand the business. Now he needs $800 for the same purpose.

Tahir is IDP from the Fizuli region. After moving from his original location he settled in Beylagan town. His familly experienced many hardships and later Tahir started his business to sustain his family. He began the trade of small home appliances. First he borrowed 400$ from Normicro, Beylagan branch. Wth his second loan of $600 he built his own shop. Now he needs $1100 to increase the variety of items sold in the shop.

Gabil now is living in Beylagan town but originally he is from Khojavand region now under occupation of Armenian troops. In 2002 he took out the first loan from Normicro Beylagan branch to start the business of trading vehicle spare parts. For his second loan amounting $900 he has built a small car repair workshop. Now he needs $1200 to buy a new pressure device.

Vagif opened a food shop in 2004 in Beylagan town and later he borrowed $500 from Normicro, Beylagan branch to buy foodstuffs to sell in the shop. Thus he has established his business. Now his business is developing and he needs to buy more foodstuff to increase the stock. For this purpose he is in need of $1000.

Mister Gabriel is a master at his profession and owns his own carpentry store. He is married with 3 children. With the loan funded by PRISMA he will buy new tools which will allow him to finish his works in less time and in effect permit him to take on more requests from his clientel as well as increase his earnings and better his family's economic standing. HE will also be able to give his children the opportunity to attend school and have a better future

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

\r\nEl Señor Gabriel es un maestro de profesión que tiene además un taller de carpintería, es casado y tiene de 3 hijos, con el dinero proporcionado por PRISMA, S.A comprará nuevas herramientas que le permitirán terminar en menos tiempo sus trabajos, lo cual le permitirá cubrir más pedidos de sus clientes, además de incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la situación económica de su familia y de sus hijos, a los cuales les podrá brindar la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela y tener un mejor futuro.

Armida M. Garcia is married and mother of 2 children. The money from loan by PRISMA will be invested to buy clothing, shoes, and beauty products such as perfumes, soap, make-up etc. The products will be sold in the various businesses that she visits. The sale of these products will allow her to increase her earnings and to better her family's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

\r\n\r\nArmida M. G. es casada, madre de 2 hijos, el dinero que le proporcione PRISMA lo invertirá en la compra de Ropa, zapatos y productos de belleza como perfumes, jabones, pinturas, etc. los cuales venderá en las distintas instituciones que ella visita. La venta de estos productos le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la esituación económica de sus familiares.

Manuel M. is a computer engineer, married and father of one son. He will invest the money from the loan by PRISMA to buy 5 computers which will enable him to modernize his cyber cafe, which is located next to a University. This location generates a large clientel and is also a great opportunity to augment his earnings and to promote his services as a computer-repair specialist.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

\r\n\r\nManuel M., ingeniero en computación, casado, padre de 1 hijo, invertirá el dinero otorgado por PRISMA, S.A en la compra de 5 computadoras que le permitirán modernizar su cyber café, el cual se sitúa al costado de una universidad, lo cual le representa una gran afluencia de clientes y por lo tanto una gran oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos y promover sus servicios de mantenimiento y reparación de computadoras.

Adelaida is a very enterprising woman. She has been in the provisions business for one year and it has gone well, however she wants to increase her product line in order to offer better service to her customers and in this way to increase her sales. For that reason she is requesting a loan of $1200 which she plans to repay within one year.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Adelaida es una mujer muy emprendedora lleva a año con su negocio de venta de viveres y el negocio a caminado bien, sin embargo ella quiere incrementar la linea de productos para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas por lo cual ella esta solicitando un prestamo de $1200.00 Dllrs los cuales piensa pagar en un periodo de 1 año.

Antonio has created a very interesting business. His product, which he sells at grocery and stationery stores, consists of numbered boxes containing toys and prizes. Children buy a ticket with a number and receive a box containing a suprise gift, which may be a toy, sweets, or balloons. The surprise is the fun part of the game. Antonio would like to extend his business to other cities and manufacture more surprise boxes, for which he is requesting a loan of $1200, which he plans to repay within one year.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Antonio ha emprendido un negocio muy interesante que vende en las tiendas de abarrotes o papelerias, sobre un carton pega un jugete o premio el cual va numerado, los niños compran un boleto con un numero y el numero que sale es el premio asignado, que generalmente son juguetes o dulces o hasta balones, lo cual es una sorpresa y lo interesante del juego, ahora Antonio quiere expanderse a otras ciudades y elaborar mas cartones sorpresa por lo que solicita un credito de $1200.00 Dllrs los cuales piensa pagar en 1 año.

Consuelo is a person with very good ideas. She decided to open a grocery store in her home, in order to provide food to her neighbors. The business has gone well but she needs to increase her product line, for which she is requesting a loan of $1200, which she plans to repay within one year.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Consuelo es una persona con muy buenas ideas por lo que decidio abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, para poder proveer de alimento a sus vecinos, el negocio a marchado bien pero necesita incremebtar sus productos por lo que solicita un credito de $1200.00 los cuales piensa pagar en un lapso de 12 meses

Zohrab is a resident of Beylagan town. He is one of the best clients of Normicro, Beylagan branch. He borrowed four loans from Normicro. His last loan was  for 1000$. Thanks to this help he developed his business. Now he needs $1200 to increase the working capital.

Ilham is the resident of Beylagan town. Before he was small market retailer and income was little. In 2006 he borrowed $800 from Normicro, Beylagan branch and built a shop near the market place. Now he needs $1100 to increase the stock of goods to be sold in the food market.

Vugar is resident of Beylagan town and until 2006 he earned his living as a market retailer. He decided to run his own business and first he borrowed $800 from Normicro Beylagan branch and constructed a shop. Now he needs 1200$ to increse working capital to increase the volume of sales.

Jafar is the resident of Beylagan town and one of the best clients of Normicro Beylagan branch. Before he was earning his living selling audio cassettes in the street. His first loan was in amount of 300$. In 2005 he built a small shop and started the trade of audio and video materials. Now he expanded his business and started selling audio and video appliances. Now he needs $1200 to expand the business in this direction.

Saleh Q. is a local small market owner in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Saleh is married with three children and is looking for funding in order to expand the types of goods he offers. He wants to expand his customer base by increasing the variety and quality of the goods he sells.
Gulshen H. is one of Azerbaijan’s growing number of young women entrepreneurs (her father is pictured). Gulshen requires funding so that she can purchase more cows to increase her livestock.

Baxish B. is a local mechanic in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Baxish wants to obtain funding so that he can purchase new tools which will enable him to increase his efficiency. He would like to increase the amount of cars he is able to work on in any given week.

Rovshen B. is a local retailer of cell phones and cell phone accessories in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of the country. Rovsen is looking for funding so that he can increase and diversify his inventory.

Aumaga’s business is a taro plantation. With her previous loan, Aumaga extended her interest in not only developing her taro plantation, but also started growing vegetables. With a helping hand from her relatives, she built a small flea market stall for Aumaga to sell her products. Aumaga is a very loving person who welcomes anyone who wants to use her market stall to sell their taros, etc. Her loving support for other ladies in her village has inspired and encouraged them to start up their own small businesses. Now her business has become successful, and she’s applying for her next loan to buy organic fertilizers and pesticides for her taro plantation.

Elenoa is a supplier of fruits and vegetables including coconut, pumpkins, pineapples, pawpaw, bananas, and spices. Her market is located at Siumu near tourist attractions like surfing and diving resorts. Her business is vibrant since she sells to a large group of people. Elenoa is very hard-working young lady, who wishes to expand her business, not only in supplying the locals, but aiming to establish an overseas market in the future.  Her existing customers are mostly village people and tourists visiting their village. One thing she’ll never forget in her life is that when the famous actor “The Rock” Dwayne Johnson visited Samoa, he actually stopped by her flea market and bought a coconut to drink.

Emma is married with 2 daughters. She started her business of making taro chips 3 years ago. Low competition and high market demand have enabled rapid growth in the business. Currently Emma has 4 stable customers, which are supermarkets and other small shops in her village. Emma is now requesting a loan of $850 to increase her production to meet the high demands of her customers. Emma has employed 2 of her sisters to help her out with her business, and uses her husband's family car for delivery.  With the support of her relatives, Emma has shared her skills of making chips with her relatives for the purpose of helping them start their own business and to provide competition for a better profit.

Faatolu, aged 43 years, is divorced with 5 children. She has a taro plantation business and aims to expand it. Her parents were doing the business but when they passed away years ago she continued growing taros to keep the business running. Faatolu’s husband went to New Zealand to seek employment to support his wife and children, but never returned to Samoa and abandoned her and her children. Faatolu had a difficult life trying to cope with what happened and bring up her children alone. The 5 children’s education was all financed by her taro plantation. Ever since Faatolu took over, the farm has expanded little by little and has now covered their 3 acres of land that was not being used. She is a serious woman and dedicated to her business to her parents. She will create employment opportunities within her business for her children when they can’t find a job.

Faauluuluga is a mother of three, living in the village of Siumu, doing a German bun business, and supplying them to Palalaua College in her village. She makes a 120 German buns a day, but that doesn't  satisfy the high of demand from the students every day. Her main goal is to hire 3 women in her village to help her provide a level of customer-friendly service that exceeds her clients’ expectations, and to supply as many German buns as needed by the clients, because she now realizes that she’s also getting orders from the families in her village. But to achieve her goal, she needs to budget her time wisely with her business and her children, with the help of her husband.

Solmaz has a plot of land, where she grows fruits and vegetables. Solmaz has been in this business for 10 years. \r\nSolmaz was born in 1948 in Khaladj village, Salyan region. \r\nShe requests  a loan of $1200 to buy seedlings.

Fotu is married with one daughter. After school she was unable to find a good-paying job in her field of training, so she decided to start her own business of growing and selling bananas. She has been in business now for 2 years. With their support, her husband and her relatives have helped her business be successful. Her main goal is to provide the best bananas to meet her clients’ expectations, and to attract new customers to her market. Her existing clients that she has served for the past two years have helped promote the dynamic growth of her business. Successful, stable growth in Fotu’s business has also help provide employment for the relatives who have helped her, and a more secure future for her family.

Heperona has been working on plantations at her small village of Siuniu in her whole life. She and her and husband, Apineru, are raising 2 children, 1 in primary school and another 2 1/2 years old. Heperona hopes to invest her money in their land towards improving her family's income. She is eager to make improvements to her house by using wood, which is cheaper and affordable to buy. On her plantation, she also has livestock like chickens and pigs, which are being looked after by her husband’s brother, but she is mainly concentrating on planting taro, because she believes that the business that she started will always provide her family's financial needs.
Sevindj supports her family with this business. She lives with 2 children in Khaladj village, Salyan region.  \r\nShe needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow and to start producing cheese.

Itagia M., aged twenty-nine years, is a youth and an elei printer by experience. Both her husband and she are self-employed in their business. Itagia came up with the idea of developing this business through our culture. In Samoan villages, we are not allowed to walk around with shorts; we must have a lavalava--a piece of material wrapped around the waist. From this Itagia came up the idea of printing flowers and different decorations on the lavalavas to persuade people to buy from her. Her business has become successful with not only the locals but also the tourists buying this lavalava  to wear as a sarong to the beach. She’s now aiming to learn more about printing on different types of materials and to expand her market overseas.

Kalameli is very energetic and is experienced in selling her products. She used to be shopkeeper for one of the supermarkets, and has always dreamed of owning a shop. Her dream came true and she has had a grocery store for 6 years, with her 5th loan of $1,200 that was wisely spent on all her products. She is very happy with her business, and she works hard every day to give the best service to her customers and to keep her store well-supplied so they will always find the product they want. For this year 2007, she is thinking of increasing the variety of products so that she can keep growing.

Makalita has been raised in a farming family. Although she was the only girl in her family, her father never treated her separately from her brothers. She was trained by her father with some farming skills. But as she grew up, she realized that her brothers had better skills than her in running the farm. She then asked her brothers to help her grow taros so she can run a taro plantation. Her three brothers have always helped  their sister with her every need. She’s now married with 5 children, still running her taro plantation and selling fruit. She hopes to be able to provide her children with a better education rather than the farming skills that she had been taught by her father.

Tahir is a very active and responsible man. 10 years ago he decided to start a small business. This business has allowed his family to have a better income. He is 36, married and has 2 children. lives with his family in Murtuzalilar village, in the Fizuli region. \r\nThe first time he borrowed $600 to start sale of agricultural produce .\r\nNow he needs a loan of $800 to buy seeds to use for the sale of produce which are used in seed farming.

Matila is a mother of seven children, three girls and four boys, five of them now married and working in Apia. Matila was employed at Sinalei Reef Resort ten years ago, and she resigned in the 1999 to take care of the grandchildren. From there she started growing vegetables beside the house, and this has now turned into a ½ acre vegetable garden, which  has developed into Matila’s everyday hobby. Now her grandchildren are all grown up, attending primary schools, but Matila has decided not to work for Sinalei but to work in her vegetable garden because she was one of their suppliers. She believes she’s earning more from selling her vegetables than by working for them.

Seyevush M. is 52 years old and is married with 3 children. Seyevush owns a car wash on the main road that passes by Aghsu. He started his business 2 years ago. He wants to improve his business and with the $500 loan purchase equipment to make his work more efficient.

Taei is married and lives Siumu with her husband and 4 children. She has always enjoyed and been good at making Samoan oil (a therapeutic oil produced from coconut oil and essential oils of Samoan plants) that is mainly used by locals to massage and heal sick people. At first it wasn't easy because she needed more time to commit to making her local oil and she had little money. She wasn’t able to make her business a reality until she joined SPBD. Taei struggled to start her business but she didn't give up the battle and 2 years after beginning her business she continues the fight to increase it every day. She’s aiming to print her own labels to attach to the bottles so that people can easily order directly  straight from her. Her own recipe for making Samoan Oil will remain with her, and she hopes to pass it on to her children in the future.

Taufau is married with one son. She used to be a teacher but she taught for only 5 years then resigned because she wasn’t unable to earn a stable salary. Seeking another source of income, Taufau decided to start her own small business. She asked permission from her relatives for a piece of land she can use, and was granted a ½ acre plot to start her taro plantation. Taufau is a Christian lady who believes in the power of prayers. She began her business in 2004 and it is becoming really successful. She supplies taro to village people who make taro chips, and also supplies hotels nearby, and has found herself a market to export her Taro to our neighboring island that is under control by America. She believes her new market of trade will help her generate additional profit. Her main goal is for her business to grow, ensuring the wellbeing of her family and helping to provide an education for her son at a good college.

Ali A. is a refugee from the region of Shusha. For the past 13 years he has lived in the village of Qaraqoyunlu in the Agsu region. Ali has raised cattle, sheep and goats for the past 10 years. He is married with two children. He is using the loan to purchase food and supplies for his livestock.

Telesia is very energetic and is experienced in making brooms. She’s a single mother of three sons. Telesia lives in a small open Samoan house with her sons. All the three sons are attending district school, and they love their mother so dearly that they always rush home after school to help their mother put together brooms. On Saturdays, all her sons used to walk around the village to sell these brooms. Some days they wouldn’t be able to sell a single broom, so Telesia would send her eldest son to the market in the city of Apia to sell the brooms. One day Telesia was overwhelmed when she received a letter from a well-known business women in Samoa asking her to sign a 3-year supplier’s contract. Telesia is overjoyed that she has found herself a market, instead of her sons walking under the heat of the sun to sell her brooms.

Tamara O. has kept bees for honey production for the last 25 years. She lives in the Gegeli village in the Agsu region with her husband and six children. She hopes to purchase more equipment to expand her business.

Valeh Q. is an Internally-Displaced Person (IDP) from the region of Shusha in Azerbaijan. He fled with his wife and children 13 years ago to the region of Ahsu in the Qaragoyunlu village. He has raised sheep and cows for the past 25 years. With this loan he hopes to purchase more livestock and to improve his business.

Soltan S. lives in the city of Agsu and owns a ironworks shop where, for the past 10 years,he has made gas and wood burning furnaces for homes and offices. He is 47 years old. Soltan is married and has two children. With this loan he hopes to purchase more materials and to expand his business.

Toaiva is a single 25 year old lady. She is from a family of six; her parents, 2 brothers and one sister. Toaiva is the youngest in the family and the only child staying with her parents. All of her brothers and sister have moved to stay with their wives and husbands. Toaiva has always helped out her father with his plantation, and so her father had faith in her and passed on his business to her. Toaiva now runs the farm with help from her boyfriend. She’s really enjoying running the business, aiming to keep the business growing to get good money to build a nice house for her parents, and maybe finance her dream wedding day.

Naiba is a 24-year old dairy woman, single, living in Khaladj village in the Salyan region .\r\nShe has run her dairy business for 10 years. With this business she provides income and provides milk for her family.\r\nNow she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.

Akenese is a young, talented woman and she’s from the village of Levi Saleimoa.  She’s forty one (41) years of age and married to a forty two (42) year old man from Tuanai.  They have six children, all raised at Levi Saleimoa.  Akenese’s family depends primarily on their fishing business that is jointly managed by both wife and husband. This additional loan will help improve their business by having more than one canoe with nets for running the business.

Aslan M. has kept bees for honey production for the past six years. He currently lives in Ulguc village in the Agsu region with his wife and three children. With this loan he wants to buy more bees for his honey production.

Xalide C. (her employee is pictured) owns a market in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. She is one of Azerbaijan’s growing number of female entrepreneurs. Xalide wants to increase the quantity and diversity of her inventory to attract more customers.

Eli I. (his employee is pictured) owns a computer/stationary store In the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Eli is looking for funding so that he can purchase new computers for his store.

30-year-old Aynura lives in Yenikand village,Salyan region. She is married and has a child.
She has run her business for 5 years.
Aynura would like to adopt new  farming technology to boost her agricultural yield.
She wants to be able to meet the financial responsibility and to maintain her family but she lacks the capital.
She requests a loan of $800 to buy fertilizer and seed.

Seyfulla Z. lives in the Ulguc village in the Agsu region of Azerbaijan. He raises cattle and sheep. He is 46 years old and is married with four children. He wants to purchase additional animals to expand his business.

Anagiz M. owns a beauty supply store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Anaqiz wants to increase the quantity and diversity of her inventory to attract more customers.

Pola T. is a woman from the village of Levi Saleimoa, born and raised at Safotu Savaii.  She’s fifty-two (52) years of age married to a man from the village of Levi Saleimoa, where they are living with their four children.  Pola is gifted by God with the talent of sewing.  She’s doing a good job to help meet her family needs, especially her children’s fees in school.  She has more than twenty people coming to her for sewing materials, and she had done a great job satisfying her customers by giving them what they have asked for. With this loan she hopes to buy an additional sewing machine and more materials to meet the growing demand for her designs.

Elchin K. lives and works in the Ulguc village in the region of Agsu. He is single and supports his mother and father. He opened up a small store one year ago and is hoping to expand his current store with the help of this loan.

Sedaget Z. (her mother is pictured) owns a furniture store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. She is one of Azerbaijan’s growing number of female entrepreneurs. She is looking for funding so that she can invest in a greater quantity and quality of furniture.

Firangiz H. has sold clothing out of her home in Agsu city for the past ten years. She is a 59-year-old widow with two children. She hopes with this loan to purchase a place in the bazaar to sell clothing.

Lima is fine, talented woman. She’s from the village of Levi Saleimoa.  She’s sixty-two years of age and she runs a pancakes canteen for the village school.  Lima’s experience in making pancakes makes her the best seller within her area.  She’s doing fine with her business and earns money to meet both the business and the family needs.  One of her sisters is helping her run the business project. A loan will help her purchase a new stove and additional ingredients for her growing pancake business.

Talib T. (his mother in pictured) owns a small market in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. He would like to increase the quantity and variety of his inventory so that he can attract more customers to his store.
Rahil M. owns a cell phone store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Rahil wants to invest in newer products for his store in order to attract more business.

Elnur H. is an Internally-Displaced Person (IDP) from the Lachin region of Azerbaijan. He fled to Agsu 13 years ago. He is married with two children. For the past three years he has owned a small booth at the local bazaar where he sells men's and women's clothing. With this loan he wants to increase his current inventory and improve his business.

Mahmud M. owns an Auto Parts store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Mahmud is looking for funding so that he can increase the number of parts available allowing him to increase his customer base.

Mahir S. lives in Agsu city and owns a small general store in the local bazaar. He opened up the store two years ago. He lost both his sister and brother during the conflict that left tens of thousands of people internally displaced.  Mahir currently supports not only his wife and two children, but also his parents as well as his brother's family. He hopes to use this loan to purchase more inventory and increase his business.

Perviz M. is 26 years old and single living in Agsu city. He started selling men's and women's clothing in the local bazaar two years ago. Perviz wants to increase his inventory by purchasing more of a selection to satisfy his local customers' needs.

Mitaina is 65 years old, from the village of Sataoa in Samoa. She used to be unemployed and mostly depended on her children for her daily needs. She joined a solidarity group organized by SPBD and took out her first loan of 750 tala (US$300) and started a small bakeshop. She bakes biscuits and cookies and delivers her goods to the different stores in the village. Her business has become so successful that she has already managed to export her biscuits to New Zealand and American Samoa (Pago Pago). Her new loan will enable her to improve her facilities and buy additional stock for producing biscuits.

Sirinbeyim M. lives in Agsu city and runs a small booth at the local bazaar selling clothing. She is married with four children. She has owned her business for three years. With this loan she hopes to expand her inventory by purchasing more stock.

Rahila M. lives in Agsu city where she has run a small booth in the local bazaar for the past eight years. She sells beauty supplies and small items for home use. She is 46 years old. Rahila wants to purchase more inventory for her store.

Arzu A. lives in Agsu city where he has owned a booth at the local bazaar selling household items for the past 10 years. He is married with three children. With this loan he wants to purchase more stock for his business and offer more variety.

Alofisa is a 45-year old lady from the village of Nuusuatia. She joined a solidarity group through SPBD four years ago and started a donut business. Every Sunday she would bake donuts which augmented her family income. After successfully paying off her first loan, she ventured into growing vegetables. Her second loan from SPBD enabled her to start a vegetable patch near her house. She was able to deliver vegetables twice a week and earn an additional US $100 per week. Her proposed loan will further enlarge her vegetable farm.

Elman H. lives in Agsu city where he owns a booth at the local bazaar selling women's clothing and shoes. He is 48 years old, married with five children. He has owned his store for 12 years. With this money he wishes to open up a second location at the bazaar selling food products.

Adil A. lives in Agsu city with his wife and two children. He owns a store at the local bazaar selling food products. He is 38 years old. With this loan he wants to purchase a refrigerator and other fixtures for his store.
Ilham A. owns a small butcher shop in the bazaar in Aghsu city. He has worked as a butcher for the past four years. With this loan he wants to purchase more animals in order to expand his business.

Nail O. lives in Agsu city where he owns a butcher shop at the local bazaar. He is 45 years old and is married with five children. With this loan he wants to purchase more animals and provide his customers with a wider choice as well.

Dargah is living in the Beylagan region and is engaged in the cattle breeding business. He sells livestock and also sells fresh meat. He has borrowed loans from Normicro Beylagan branch for a long time. His first loan was in the amount of $400. Now, his fifth time he applies for a loan and needs $1200 to expand his business.

Nurida is a resident of the Beylagan region. She started her private business in 2004 borrowing the first loan in  the amount of $500 from Normicro, Beylagan branch. For the first loan she increased the stock of goods and working capital. Now she needs a new counter-refrigerator to store meat and diary products.

Yegana S. lives in Agsu city and owns a small store where she sells food and household products. She is a 56-year-old widow with four children. With this loan she wants to purchase more inventory for her store.

Vaqif S. owns a small car wash off the main road that passes by Agsu city. He is 38 years old and married with four children. He has owned his business for the past six years. With this loan Vaqif wants to purchase better equipment for his shop.

Mashuga is  an IDP from the Fizuli region and now her family is living in Beylagan region. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $400 and bought one cow. She sells milk now. She is in need of new loans to increase the number of cows.

Ali is the resident of the Beylagan region. In 2004 he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan of $400. He was engaged in cattle breeding and selling, a traditional business in rural areas. Now he is in need of a new loan to increase the number of livestock.

Dilruba is an IDP from occupied Lachin region. She settled in Beylagan region with her family in 1992. As traditionally they were engaged in cattle breeding she started this business in Beylagan. Her first loan from Normicro Beylagan branch was in the amount of $500. They buy cattle, breed them and sell to butchers. Now she needs $1100 to buy cattle and expand the business.

Teyar M. owns a small metal shop in  Qaraqasli village in the Agsu region. He is married. In his shop he practices the trade of his family for seven generations of making pots, pans, utensils, and other metal items for home and business use. With this loan Teyar wants to purchase equipment with better technology than what he is currently using.

Geray is a man from Yardimli district of Azerbaijan. He started his private business in 1998, and in 2005-2006 borrowed three loans for a total of $1100.  Now he wants to borrow 700$ to increase assortment of goods in his shop.

Vugar is local and lives in Beylagan town. In 2002 he started the business of selling home and kitchen items. Later he built a small store. He has borrowed several loans from Normicro Beylagan branch. The last loan was in amount of $900. Now Vugar is in need of $1200 to expand the business and to increase working capital.

Hidayat is 62 years old, married, has 4 children and lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region.
He works hard for the success of his children. He likes to breed pedigree ewes.
Hidayat has had his business for 10 years and it allows him to support his family. He wants to offer  an education to all  his children that allows them to continue their own lives and to be an honest and hard-working people.
Now he needs a loan of $500 to buy 10 pedigree ewes.

Malakxanim Z. owns a small store in Agsu city where she sells food and other household products. She has owned this store for eight years. She is married with two children. Malakxanim wants to purchase more inventory as well as fixtures to improve the store.

Aybeniz is a resident of Beylagan town. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed her first loan of $400 and started the business of sheep breeding. The business went quite well and she took  out subsequent loans of $600 and $800. Now she wants to add more sheep to the herd and increase the income from the business.

Gulshan is an IDP from Kalbajar region who moved to Beylagan in 1992 as a result military conflict with Armenia. As with most of the IDPs it was very difficult to survive at first. To sustain the family  Gulshan started the traditional business of cattle breeding with her husband. She is long time client of Normicro Beylagan branch starting with her first loan in amount of $300. Now she needs $1000 to increase the number of livestock.

Novrasta came to Baku from the Qazax district of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 2000. In 2005-2006 she borrowed a total of $1300. Now she wants to borrow 800$ to buy more materials for the business.

Aziza is an IDP from the Armenian occupied Fizuli region. Now her and her family resides in the Beylagan region. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan  of $500. She bought a milking cow and started selling milk and milk products. Now she wants to have two more cows to expand the business.

This single man was born in 1978 in Khaladj village, Salyan region .\r\nHikmet has a small grocery store where he sells products. He has had his store for 10 years.\r\nHe requests a loan of $1000 to increase the variety of products he sells.

Habil is a resident of Beylagan town. He started his private business in 2004. As most private businesses in town he began selling foodstuffs. As for the capital he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed four loans. Now he owns a food store and he needs new loan to increase the stock of goods and working capital.

Elmira is living in Baku city. She and her husband started their family business in 2000. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two loans from Normicro Baku branch, for a total amount of $1100. She used these loans for business expansion. Now she wants to borrow  an additional $700. This loan will mainly be used for increasing the variety of goods and increasing the volume of sales. Her husband is in the photo.

Maharram is a resident of Beylagan town. He has a small canteen in the town and also he is engaged in cattle breeding. He has his own supply of meat for the canteen. His business has developed \r\nconsiderably. He has borrowed four loans fron Normicro Beylagan branch, last for $600. Now he needs $1200 to increase the number of livestock.

Being an IDP, Ingilis settled in the Beylagan region. He decided to start a business to sustain the family and in 2003 he took out the first loan in for $400 from Normicro Beylagan branch. He is engaged in cattle breeding and selling. Now he wants $1100 to increase the number of livestock and to build a shed.

Ehtiram is an Internally Displaced Person from Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He came to Baku in 1993, and started his business in 1996.  In 2005-2006 he borrowed two loans from Normicro Baku branch. The total amount he borrowed is $1,100. Now he wants to borrow $700 to increase the variety of goods.

Aydin is the resident of Beylagan town. As with most people in rural areas, he is engaged in cattle and sheep breeding. Since 2004 he borrowed four loans from Normicro Beylagan branch. He uses the loans to increase his number of livestock. He has 25 sheep now and he wants to increase this number. For this he needs $1,200.

This single man is a very active and responsible. He has a plot of land where he grows fruits.
Ramil has been in this business for 6 years.
He was born in 1987 in Khaladj village, Salyan region. 
Ramil needs a loan of $600 to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

Najaf is the resident of Beylagan. He owns a small blacksmith workshop where he makes iron gates, doors etc. He has run his business since 2004. He borrowed three loans from Normicro Beylagan branch; the last one amounting to $600. Now he needs $1,100 to buy raw materials for his business.
