She has a sheep-fattening business and has moderate experience in the field. She is standing on the far right of the picture. Her loan will be used to buy 2 sheep so that she can earn a large income. She wishes to use her profits to build her savings with the banc villageois.

The banc villageois, to which this group belongs, was created on the 19th of September, 2004. The group is made up of 6 members who live in the same village. They enjoy good relationships with each other and are supportive of one another. Their main businesses are retail, livestock-fattening and the restaurant business.\r\n\r\nSokhna, standing on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is 73 years old. She is married and the mother of 7 children, 1 boy and 6 girls. Her main business is retail, a line of work she has been in for around 20 years. She plans to use this loan to buy bags of cabbages, carrots and aubergines, so that she can strengthen her vegetable-selling business. She will use the remainder of the money to buy 2 bags of second-hand clothing which she will sell at the weekly markets. The profits she makes enable her to increase her savings and meet her family's needs.

Ena, 45, is divorced from her spouse.  She has an eight year old son who attends an elementary school in the sector they live in.  She comments that she’s been a hardworking woman and thanks to God she’s raised her son with much love even though he has no father.  She comments that her son has never lacked anything.  For this reason she has a food business.  Ena works every day from 6am until 3pm.  Her goal is to have a locale of her own and to improve her house.  She will use the loan to buy meat, foodstuffs, condiments, etc. Her dream is to give a better life to her child.

Ms. Alma Rosa recently became a widow.  She has one adopted son, who she is still responsible for.  She is requesting this loan to buy a roof for a room to make it more durable and safe.  She currently does not have enough money to finish this job.  \n\nMs. Alma Rosa operates a business selling beauty products from a catalog with her neighbors and family members, and occasionally she goes to other parts of the city.  Part of the profits she obtains from her business will be used to pay this loan, and she uses the rest of the profit to give the best to her son.  She hopes to improve the quality of life for her son so that he can have his own space in the house.  She hopes to receive another loan with lender support, since she has had three Kiva loans, and has always had a good repayment history.

Janet is a 25-year-old woman, single, and lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and siblings. She is a very happy, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Sadly, because of a lack of economic resources and her need to work to support her parents, Janet was not able to study for the nursing degree she wanted, but she would have liked to have been able to do it very much. In her free time, she likes to play sports, and on some occasions, she cooks a very tasty rice with duck to share with her family. \n\nWith much effort, dedication and help from her mother, Janet began her small business selling groceries and drinks. Every day, she starts work early in the morning. She can serve approximately 25 customers, and she believes that things are going well due to her good service. Janet is very grateful for Kiva lenders, because the help given will allow her to buy merchandise for her business, such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, mixed vegetables, noodles, soft drinks, among other things. In this way, she will have a better-stocked business with which she hopes to be able to raise her sales and increase her income. This will help her a lot to be able to grow her business, and she hopes to be able to achieve her great dream of having her own house and her own premises for developing her business.

Tahani is a 26 year old married female from Sahab in Jordan. She has 2 children and has requested a 1,200 JOD loan to buy woman and children clothes to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same of area. In the future, Tahani is planning to obtain a large room for storing the clothes she sells and improve the living conditions of her family.\n\nSince Tahani is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

This young man, Miguel is requesting a loan for the construction of a wooden room in front of his house. He has recently started a business selling groceries, because there is no close store in his area where he can shop for what they need.  

Miguel is single, and works at a factory in the production area.  He will use part of his salary to pay for this credit.  He lives with his mother, who shares the household expenses.  

Miguel hopes to have his own business and to have air conditioning in his room.

Dania is a single young woman of 26 years of age.  She studied computer technology and worked with her father in the business, but he died and she has been in charge of the cyber cafe business for 3 years.  To begin with, it was very difficult for her to assume this responsibility, and taking the business forward was a painstaking process.  Now, however, she enjoys it and has everything under control.  She now supports her mother and hopes that, in the future, she will be able to extend the premises so that, when she marries and has children, she can provide the necessary conditions for their well-being.  \r\n\r\nDania needs this initial loan to make improvements to the business premises.  She wants to concrete over a wooden wall which has deteriorated over time and will buy breeze-blocks, cement, sand, iron, wall supports and fastening wire.  She will also use the loan to pay her workforce.

Celia is 39 years old, from a farming family, and completely dedicated to this work. Her husband now works as a construction worker and with this income they support each other with the household expenses. Thanks to God her children are continuing their studies, despite the obstacles that they faced due to the lack of funding for farming. However, little by little they acquired loans and repaid their installments on time. \n\nToday Celia is requesting her eighth loan to maintain a plot of land sown with pineapples by buying fertilizer, urea and insecticides. This will allow her to offer better products to her customers, and in the future to augment her sowing of pineapples to two plots of land, thus make more profits to support her family.

Oscar is a fifty-year-old man who comes from a farming family.  He has approximately 1.75 acres of land planted with pineapples, and also works as a security guard. This is because he alone has to cover the various household expense.  His wife does not work as it is so difficult to find a job at the moment. \n\nHe has had problems with his crops due to pests, but he gets by as best he can, overcoming all obstacles.  The loan which he is applying for is to buy insecticide, fertiliser and urea so as to take precautions against such problems.  He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to plant 3.5 acres with pineapples, along with other crops for a bit of variety, and to leave his grandchildren secure jobs from which to make a living.

Jose Andrei lives in Cartago, Costa Rica. He has more than six years of working with dairy cattle. Dairy is one of his passions and this is why he wants a loan of 500,000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy a dairy cow, with which he can begin his dairy project.\r\n \r\nHe knows that an additional cow requires a lot of work and sacrifice for both himself and his mother, who helps him with the work. Still, his desire to run his own successful business and continue to improve the quality of life for his family are a great motivation for him.

Carlos is 43 years old and lives in the city of Chincha with his partner and 8-year-old son. He loves his family dearly, and they are his principal motivation in life. He is a kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who, together with his partner, does his best to provide a good life for his family. Unfortunately, Carlos was not able to study to be a civil engineer as he would have liked. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors and sometimes cooks delicious chicken and rice for his family.  \r\n\r\nCarlos has a small mototaxi and works hard seven days a week offering transport services. He sets off early every morning to go around the city streets looking for customers, and works around 12 hours a day. He believes that his hard work has been the key to his success. Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with their help, he will be able to buy merchandise (men's, women's, and children's clothes) in order to start a small clothes-selling business with his partner. Carlos wants to continue working hard to be able to provide a good education and quality of life for his son.

Glenda is a client who lives in the Jonathan González area of Managua. Her business is selling cosmetics and clothing. She has been doing this for around 11 years. She distributes her products around the city to private customers. \r\n\r\nGlenda is requesting her eighth loan to buy stock for her business - perfume, compacts, make up, trousers and ladies' and men's shirts - so that she can continue to progress as she has done in the past. She is a single mother and has supported her two children in their studies. Now they help her and are independent, thanks to Glenda's support through her loans.

Aracely is a client who is a mother of two children who study. She works tirelessly for their education and well-being, doing her best, because she wants her children to be great professionals. She does not have the support of their father now, but this has not been an obstacle to progress for her. She always works for a free trade zone as an assembly plant worker, and works for more than eight hours a day to provide for her home. \r\n\r\nAracely is applying for her third loan in order to carry out infrastructure improvements. She she needs to buy zinc sheets and purlins to repair the roof of her home that is in poor conditions, so that her family can live in better conditions. That is why she has come to request loan support and is grateful for the help obtained.

Jazmina lives in the neighbourhood of Monseñor Lezcano. For about seven years she has sold clothing and cosmetics on a continuous basis, articles that she delivers to order and which she stores at home. Her children are growing all the time and are studying to be professionals in the future. This is Jazmina's greatest dream. Thanks to her mother's help she has been able to give her children a good education, as she herself is a single mother. She is applying for a fourth loan to invest in two bags of second-hand clothing, in order to be able to continue working and to offer her customers variety.

Due to cultural reasons, Reem prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Reem is a 32-year-old married female from Sahab, Jordan. She has six children.

She has requested a loan of 1000 Jordanian dinar to pay for her home improvement expenses and for building additional rooms.

In the future, Reem is planning to build another floor and a store room opposite the house.

This group is composed of 38 women all from the same village. They all get along well together living in harmony.

The featured borrower of this group is Wedji. She is a married woman, 50 years old, and the mother of six children, including three boys. She has a small-scale business selling detergents, earrings, etc. and has been in this business for over ten years. She resupplies herself from Dakar, Touba, or Louga. In the photo, she is standing at the right with her hand raised.

With her loan, she would like to purchase 2 buckets of detergents and 2 head of sheep to fatten. 

With her profits, she helps her children by covering their schooling costs.

This group was created on December 30, 2009. It comprises six women from the same village. They are organized by affinity and neighborhood. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and the fattening of sheep. 

Magatte Mamadou (standing at the right in the photo) is the group's official. She is 38 years old and has four children to support. She has a business selling clothing. Parallel to this, she fattens sheep. She has been doing this work for a long time. 

Her loan will enable her to purchase merchandise: 10 lengths of cloth, 10 packets of accessories for 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and some sheep for business purposes and for satisfying her customers. Her goal is to support her family and to bolster her savings at every group meeting.

This group is composed of 6 women all from the same village. They live in perfect harmony. 

The featured borrower in this group is Couma Salla. She is a 36-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two children, including one boy. She has a small-scale businesses and fattens animals to sell. In the photo, she is the one standing with her hand raised.

With her loan, she would like to purchase 1 kg of black pepper, a packet of Jumbo, 1 kg of chili peppers, and 4 head of sheep to fatten.

With the profits, she helps out her husband in covering family expenses and saves money at the 'banc villageois'.

This group is composed of 20 women all from the same village. They live in the same town and are developing good friendly relations.

The group's representative, Mame Diarra, is a married woman, 39 years old, who has six children, including four boys. She has a small-scale business selling cloth. She also raises animals and is a farmer. In the photo, she is the one standing at the right wearing orange.

With her loan, she would like to purchase 10 rolls of 'maylous' cloth, 1 basin, and 5 head of sheep to fatten. 

With the profits, she helps out her husband in covering family expenses. The profits enable her to save money at every group meeting.

Norma is a first-time loan client with Afodenic. She is 39 and is married with three children, all of whom study and are dependent on her and her husband. Norma's husband helps her with the household expenses with his salary. A year ago Norma started a small general store, which helps with the family's finances to support the household. She is requesting a loan of 16,000 córdobas to buy dairy products, grains, sweets, soft drinks and other items. By investing in her business in this way she will be able to provide a higher income for her family, as well as enabling her children to finish their professional training.

María Auxiliadora is 41 years old and lives in the capital city.  Her husband works in telecommunications.  She is very hard-working and has gotten ahead through her work as a stylist.  With her husband's support, she has been building her house little by little in order to give her only son, who is studying, as well as her clients, greater comfort.\r\n\r\nShe and her husband continue to make improvements to their housing since everything has to be done a little at a time due to insufficient funds.  She is now requesting her fourteenth loan in order to put in a ceramic tile floor, for which she needs to purchase putty and cement, and pay for labor.

Eduarda is a 62-year-old woman who lives in the city of Chincha. She has three grown-up children whom she loves and who are her main reason for living. Sadly Eduarda lost her dear husband, and since then has been the main pillar of her family. Eduarda was not able to undertake further education as she had to work to help her parents from a young age, but she would have liked to study nursing. In her free time she likes to make straw hats and she sometimes cooks a delicious lamb stew to share with her family.

On her own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Eduarda started a small business selling drinks several years ago. At the weekend she also sells food, such as her delicious chicken soup and chanfainita [a kind of beef stew]. She starts work early every morning and works for around 10 hours. She thinks she is doing well thanks to her delicious seasoning and the experience she has of running her business.

Eduarda is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because the help she receives will enable her to buy merchandise such as sodas, soft drinks and beer, among other items, as well as ingredients to prepare her delicious soups and stews. In this way Eduarda hopes to increase her sales and her income, which will help her to grow her business. In the not too distant future she would like to finish the building work at the back of her home.

Juana is a 38-year-old woman, is single, and lives in the city of Ica. She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who has a great desire for self-improvement. Thanks to her efforts and to the support of her family, Juana was able to study the professional career of primary education. In her spare time she likes to walk the warm and friendly streets of her city and on some occasions cooks a delicious Arroz con Pollo [chicken with rice], which is her favorite dish.

With much determination and dedication, and thanks to the support of her sister, Juana works in her small business selling groceries. Every day she starts her work in the early hours of the morning. She can work approximately 10 hours daily, and believes that her business is doing well because of the variety of products and because of the friendly service that she offers her customers. 

Juana is very grateful for the Kiva loans, as thanks to the support offered she was able to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, and pulses, among other items. She will also be able to buy a display cabinet and a counter in order to be able to better display her products. In this manner Juana hopes to be able to increase her sales and increase her income, which will be very useful to be able to expand her business. In the not too distant future she wants to realize her dream of having her own minimarket.

Rosa Lina lives in the municipality of San Ignacio. Her husband works as a driver, and with this income he helps her with the household expenses, hoping that, at some time in the future, their standard of living will improve. She has been involved in the sale of fruit and vegetables for many years. During this time her biggest difficulty has been the lack of working capital in order to continue investing in her business. However, now with the opportunity that AFODENIC offers via Kiva, it is easier to go ahead with this first loan, which she has requested to supply her small shop with papayas, melons, bananas, oranges, potatoes, chilies, pineapples, carrots, yuccas, and bananas, among other things. She will then sell these items in several provinces of the country and, in this way, achieve a better standard of living for her children and family.

Rolando is a 45-year-old, happily married man. He lives in the town of Pucallpa with his wife and four small children, whom he loves dearly and who are his main reason for living. He is a friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, dedicates all of his efforts to ensure that his family get ahead. Rolando was not able to study to become a professional because, from a very young age, he had to work, in order to help his parents with the household expenses. However, he would very much have liked to have been able to study to be a car mechanic. In his free time he likes to play football with his friends and neighbours, and sometimes his wife spoils him and cooks him delicious chicken with rice.

With a lot of determination and dedication, and thanks to the help of a friend, Rolando set up his small business cutting keys. He starts work early in the morning every day. He has about 10 hours of work, and thinks that his business is going well because of the quality of his work and the friendly way he deals with his customers.

Rolando is very grateful for the Kiva loans, as thanks to the help that they provide, he will be able to make some improvements to his home by painting and decorating it. In this way, Rolando hopes to provide a more adequate and safe environment, where his family can live safely. In this way, he will continue working and striving to achieve his dream of owning his own hardware store and of seeing his children grow up to be good professionals.

Fidencio, 50, is requesting this loan from Credituyo to stock his candy store with merchandise because he doesn't have very much and he wants more sales.\n\nFidencio is married and has two children.  He comments that sales have been a bit slow because of his lack of merchandise.  Fidencio has had his candy shop for three years.

Oscar is a young 27-year-old man, and lives in the district of Ticuantepe with his mother. He is single. His biggest dream is to be able to build a little house, at some time in the future, in order to be independent. He works for a private company, and with his income he helps his mother with the household expenses. \r\n\r\nThe loan that Oscar has applied for is to build a room in order to have a little more privacy. He cannot finance this investment all in one go, because his wages are very low. Consequently, with this loan, he intends to buy all the materials necessary to start the job: - cement, sand, steel and blocks, and he will also pay for the labour. He is grateful for the support and trust that Kiva, via Afodenic, place in him, enabling him to improve his quality of life.

José is a 32-year-old, single man who lives with his mother and siblings in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial. He is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with dreams of excelling. Unfortunately, José was not able to study a professional career because he had to begin working at a very young age. He started working in construction and, when times were good, he put away money he later used to buy his own motor rickshaw. 

With much determination and dedication, José leaves early each morning to travel the streets of Imperial in search of passengers. José believes he has been successful so far because he is well-known in the area and always makes sure to deliver good service to his passengers.

José is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with the help of this loan, he will be able to pay for the regular maintenance of his vehicle. He will make repairs on his motor, redo the upholstery, and put new tires on his motor rickshaw. With a better vehicle, José hopes to get more passengers and increase his profits. In this way, he will continue working and making an effort to realize his dream of one day owning his own construction company and his own house.

Roberto is a 67-year-old man living in the city of Pucallpa. He has 3 children who are already grown and whom he loves – they are his principal reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has dedicated all his efforts to advancing his family. Lamentably, for diverse reasons, for several years now, he has been separated from his wife. Roberto was unable to pursue professional studies but he would have liked very much to have studied vehicle welding. In his free time he likes to attend church to thank God for all the blessings he has been given and, on some occasions, he cooks a rich Rice with Chicken to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Roberto launched his small business selling dried fish. He initiates work every day from the early hours of the morning. Roberto works approximately 8 hours, during which time he attends to an average of 15 customers, and he believes that the business is going well, due to his good prices and the service he offers his customers.

Roberto is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, due to their help, he has been able to purchase more fish to supply his business. In this manner, Roberto hopes to augment his sales and increase his income, which will serve greatly to, little by little, expand business and help him and his family advance daily.

Abdurazaki, who is in his late 30s, is married with two children who are still going to school.  He has been selling fruits and vegetables for one year now.  He works from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell and has been able to pay back his loan successfully.  His dream is to one day be able to expand his business and to improve his business premises.
 
Abdurazaki will share this loan with his loan group, Twitange, which has a total of 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Richardi, who is in his late 20s, is married with one child, who goes to school.  

He has been selling food for three years now. He works from 9 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use for buying a fridge and to restock the inventory in his food store. His dream is to one day be able to open a grocery store.

Richardi will share this loan with his loan group "Sunguchini," which has a total of 10 members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Hilda is 36 years old and a resident of the city of Managua.  She is married with three children aged 19, 13 and a 9-month-old baby.  The two older children are students.  Hilda has been working daily for approximately five years selling cosmetics and clothing, in order to provide for her family along with her husband.  This is her first loan with AFODENIC.  With this loan she will build a front wall for her house, for which she needs to buy cement, blocks, sand, iron, wire tires and planks and to pay for the labor.  Only with the support of financing will she be able to carry out this work, since she does not have sufficient capital.  However, with the loan it will be a little easier, and it will benefit her family by allowing them to live in better conditions.

Viviana, 32, is married and has been in the business of selling clothing for 4 years. Her husband is Homero. He has been working in a notary for 9 years. \r\n\r\nBoth want to expand their house thinking of their two young daughters whom they want to leave a good estate. That is why they are requesting this loan; to build a room on the ground floor. Each of their daughters would have their own room and the privacy they need.

Sr. Luis is 44 years old and single, but in a common-law relationship.  Luis finished elementary school and lives in his own home.  He has three children who are financially dependent on him.  

Luis engages in farming activities such as growing potatoes, beans, peas, and carrots on land that he owns.  He waters his crops by utilizing the irrigation and sprinkler systems that are shared within the community of K’ayarari in the town of Tíraque.  This area is located quite some distance from the city of Cochabamba, specifically at Km. 89 along the old highway to Santa Cruz.  

Luis and his family say that they want to improve and increase their farming production.  In order for this to happen, they need to request investment capital for buying farming supplies.  By obtaining a loan in this manner, he will be able to generate more income so that he can improve his family’s quality of life.

Rubén lives in Sacaba, one of the provincial districts in the city of Cochabamba.  He is married to Sra. Paola and they have three daughters.  Rubén is a mechanic by profession, but he also owns a taxi so that he can work at night.  He had a very difficult childhood since his father died when he was a boy.  At that point, he had to help his mother raise his younger siblings.  Rubén began working as a mechanic’s assistant and then studied at night so that he could finish high school and complete a short program in auto repairs.  His wife works as a caregiver for elderly people.  \n\nRubén is requesting a loan so that he can replace the engine of his vehicle since this is the means by which he is able to earn the extra income he needs to complete his education and feed his family.  He wants to finish a degree in Dentistry.  Rubén and Sra. Paola are working double shifts so that they can have more income to help their daughters finish school and pursue degrees of their own.  Rubén is a responsible and hardworking individual.

Sr. Hermes is 29 years old and lives in Chimoré, which is in the Department of Cochabamba.  He is a hardworking farmer who learned everything he knows about his trade to date from his father and brother.  

Hermes is a simple person who has always been used to working in the field.  At a very young age, he had to confront some very difficult situations in his life.  On several occasions, he participated in investment opportunities and was taken advantage by the other partners since they did leave not leave him any profits or allow him to recover his original investment.  

His situation today is much more stable since he has requested assistance from his family to help him recoup his losses.  Hermes learned about the Kiva loans, so he is requesting one so that he can pay for labor and a few supplies that he needs for cultivating his land.  He is single, but dreams about having a family and providing them the best that he can offer.

Sr. Humberto works as a welder at a small soldering workshop.  He has one year of experience.  Humberto is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  \n\nOn this occasion he is seeking a home improvement loan so that he can renovate his bedroom since it is a little worn.  Therefore, he is seeking assistance from Kiva.

This group consists of four entrepreneurs who have worked with ADIM for the past five years.  One of them is Jilma del Carmen, who sells meals and fried foods from her house at night.  At the moment, she also rents out a few small rooms as a side business.  Her loan will be invested in the purchase of basic grains such as rice, as well as oil, beans, beef, chicken, and other items.  

Yalila Damaris sells used clothing and shoes from her home.  She and her husband have a small van that they use to provide transportation services in their community.  Part of her loan will be invested in the maintenance of her taxi so that she can generate additional income.

Marline del Socorro sells Nicaraguan tamales on the weekends.

Mauricio has owned a cybercafé for several years.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy two computers and to replace accessories that are in bad condition.  This improve the service to his customers.

Doña Rosa is 54 years old. She sells clothing in her home and she also goes out to sell her products on the street. She has four children, all of whom are adults and have careers. The only difficulty that she has had was when her husband died, but thanks to the help of God, she managed to advance, along with her children, overcoming this great loss. Now it is in her plans to improve the condition of her house to have a worthy and better residence. For this she is applying for her first loan to make improvements in a room of her house. The materials that she needs to buy for this purpose are blocks, cement, sand, sheets of zinc, and plywood, and she needs to pay for labor. With this she will be able to do the work, thanks to the financing, since she is not able to cover this expense in a single payment.

Adriana, 65, is happily married.  She lives in the city of Ica with her husband and their two children, the heart and soul of her life.  Adriana is a happy and enthusiastic person.  She and her husband have worked hard all their lives to make a better life for their family.  She would have liked to have studied for a career but, unfortunately, she had to leave school early.  In her spare time, she likes to cook, and she tells us that chicharrones de pollo is a special favorite for her family.\r\nAdriana has a farming business that she has worked hard to build over many years.  She grows grapes, working on her small farm every day, from early in the morning.  She likes the work and says that she's successful because she learned farming from her parents and has worked at it all of her life.  \r\nAdrian is grateful to Kiva lenders because their help will provide the funds she needs to maintain her crop: irrigating it, fertilizing it, weeding it, etc.  The investment will allow her to harvest a good crop and continue developing her business.  For the future, Adriana hopes to continue working and live for many years more at the side of her beloved family.

Miguel is a married man whose wife is a teacher in a school in the city.  He has a three-year-old son.  Miguel has been a taxi driver for over 2 years, working in and around Ica and also offering his services to tourists in the city's hotels.\n\nThe challenge he faces is that he is in the taxi all day, and sometimes until the early hours of the morning, in order to earn a little more money to cater for his family's well-being.  Miguel is very grateful to Kiva lenders for his loan, as  this is the second time that he has received their support.  The loan will enable him to improve his grocery business by cementing over the walls and buying stock, which will allow him to improve his income and strive to realise his greatest dream: "To finish building his house and buy another vehicle so as to improve his family's quality of life".

Dario is 47 years old, and has operated a business renting and repairing computers for 12 years.  He is requesting a loan to buy computers and computer parts since his machines need maintenance.  He will then be able to provide better service to his clients, the majority of whom are students who go to get help with homework.  He hopes to achieve this with the help of Kiva.

Margarita is married, her husband is an electrician and owns his own business.  Margarita has a small used clothing business, and she has been running it successfully for many years..  \n\nShe is asking for a loan to buy more clothes that are currently in style and therefore increase her sales and profit.  She hopes for lender support from Kiva.

Mr. jose Carlós is originally from the state of Tabasco and has been in his city for more than 10 years in general commerce and wants to fully commit himself to the sales of groceries.  Mr. Jose Carlos has been running a natural foods store for several years and is now asking for a loan to change directions and fill a shop with groceries, a project that he began about two months ago.

Doña Bertha is 40 years old. Her partner is a self employed construction worker, and they have three children. The oldest, who is 18 and already working, studies, and helps them.Their business is selling clothes, footwear, cosmetics and domestic appliances. 

She needs this fifth loan to stock up on these goods. The investments she has already made have helped to improve her life, by saving their earnings and making their home more comfortable. She hopes to continue investing in the business and gain more customers. 

She also works at a wholesaler there. There she earns more money so that she can break even with the expenses. She wants her children to make the most of their studies and better themselves.

Eufemio is 50 years old and his wife is a housewife. They have three children. He’s a hard worker who is providing his children with education so that they can face life. Eufemio has a cyber café business managed by his eldest son of 23 years. He also sells propane, works as a builder and is the pastor of an Evangelical church. \r\nHe has used the loans to make house improvements. This is his 13th loan and will be used to continue building the back wall of his house. He needs to buy quarry stones, cement blocks, struts, cement, support straps, iron and payment for manual labor to continue the small development project with his family.

Griselda is 39 years old. Her husband works in a lathe workshop and helps with home expenses and their three children, the oldest of whom is 16. Her great wish is for them to prosper in life through their studies and be professionals. She works as a janitor in a poultry business. Her last loan was for building a front wall, but she was not able to build the wall since she built the entire living room of her house out of concrete. Now she will use this loan for sewage installation and the construction of a bathtub and toilet. She will buy PVC pipes, a toilet, sand, blocks and cement, and will also pay for labor, and this way she will continue making improvements to her home little by little.

Carla is a young, nineteen-year-old woman who lives alongside her parents in the city of Imperial.  The city is characterized as having a warm and welcoming climate, as well as being known for its farming and, above all, for the generosity of its people.  Carla is hard-working and makes a living in her small business where she has been selling snack items for the past two years.  

Her parents live in humble conditions and due to some money problems, they were not making enough to be able to cover the home expenses. With savings and a lot of effort, she succeeded in starting her business.  She works about ten hours a day and believes that her business is going well because she is very kind to her customers and has a lot of desire to continue moving forward.

Carla is very thankful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to the great support that they have offered her, she will be able to buy display counters and a refrigerator.  With these items she will be able to display her products in a better way and also keep her products in good condition, thereby increasing her income.  She will continue fighting to be able to make her biggest dream come true: "to study a career at the university and to be able to support her family."

Sang, 56, is married with 10 children. Seven of them are single and three are married.  Sang runs a pig farm in the backyard of her house and also has a rice farming business. She has been in this type of business for over five years. She breeds and raises hogs to sell to local traders or butchers in her community upon their optimum growth while her husband is involved in trading firewood to support their living. Through their determination and sacrifices, they hope for a higher income and to enable their children to finish their studies at high school level minimum.\r\n\r\nFor great changes in their current businesses, Sang would like to acquire a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase a plowing machine for farming. This tool can also be used for transportation purposes whenever they attach it with a trailer. Sang’s husband will be able to load his firewood and distribute it to marketplaces quickly. She hopes that the loan will be granted to her to develop their businesses as well as their standard of living.

Kim is 49 years and a responsible mother of two school-aged children. She and her spouse raise their children in small community of Kampong Chhnang province. Kim has a business position and manages a stall in a local market where she sells a variety of fish. She has been in this occupation for almost 10 years, earning approximately 13,000 KHR per day. Kim’s husband finances the family with income generated from trading poultry and animals.\r\n\r\nTo help Kim’s husband with transportation support in his trading activities, Kim is asking for a loan in the sum of 4,000,000 KHR to purchase a motorcycle. This purchase will enable her husband in transporting his products to the marketplaces. She hopes that someday her family-owned businesses will grow and become a viable source of income as they continuously strive to improve.

Yin is a 41-year-old farmer living with his family in Kompong Speu province. Rice farming is the primary business and source of income for his family. He grows rice on a few hectares of farmland and he is able to make a decent income to supply the household. However, the income is barely enough to cover his daily costs, so he also works as a paid laborer for additional income. Most of the villagers appreciate his hard work. Yin’s wife opened a tailoring shop in their community to help him in generating a livelihood and uplifting a better standard of living.\r\n\r\nRecently, Yin has hired a few laborers to perform the construction in renovating his present house but he has insufficient capital. Therefore, he is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to purchase supplies needed for the construction. Yin has nevertaken a loan with HKL before and it will be his first loan. He promises to pay it back in full.

Chum is 31 years old and was born in Kompong Speu province. She has a common law relationship with her spouse and has been blessed with one child. She also has a younger sister who lives with her under the same roof. She manages her own farmland on which she usually grows rice in each rainy season to make a livelihood while her husband distributes and trades firewood from his trailer. This direct selling business depends on proper transportation and trailer loads of firewood. \r\n\r\nChum needs a loan to be able to purchase a bigger trailer for transporting a large amount of firewood to the marketplaces. The previous trailer is old and barely suitable to use--that’s why Chum needs to buy a trailer to sustain the business. She hopes the purchase will enable them to make a better income as well as to grow their firewood business.

Chea is originally from Kompong Speu province. He lives there with his spouse and some of his children. Presently, six of his children are already married while the remaining child is single and helps them with the farming business.  Chea and his wife help each other manage their own farmland for their livelihood. Together, they are able to generate income in the neighborhood of USD 4.00 per day and they have been in the business for more over 30 years. Despite their hardships, Chea would like to help their descendants to get a higher education. \r\n\r\nThe purpose of the loan he requested from HKL and Kiva is to pay for tuition fees for his grandchild who is attending a university. He believes that he will be able to help him finish his education so that he can have a bright future someday.

Kang, aged 30, is the head of his family that is comprised of four members. He is married to a garment worker and is blessed with two children. He untiringly works at the rice field to provide daily sustenance to his family. Kang has been in this occupation for more than seven years, earning an average income of 7,000 KHR per day. \r\n\r\nAt this time, Kang would like to renovate his house partially in order to keep his family in good conditions. Due the lack of capital, he is now asking for a loan in the sum of 1,500 USD to pay for construction costs and to purchase construction materials such as window frames, planks of wood and nails. In the future, Kang hopes to make improvements in farming business and help his children in their education. He promises to pay back his loan in full.

Khawla is a 39-year-old married female from Al Karak in Jordan. She requested a 600 JOD loan to buy clothes to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same of area. In the future, Khawla is planning to expand her project and increase her income in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Due to cultural reasons Badria prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son. Badria is a 55-year-old married woman who has 2 family members from Al Hashmi Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to do maintenance on the home, and she would like to add a balcony. She hopes in the future to create a comfortable space for her family.

Amal is a 40-year-old married female from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has four children and requested a 600 JOD (Jordan dinar) loan to pay for her home-improvement expenses and to buy some furniture. In the future, Amal is planning to do further improvements to improve the living conditions of her family.

Naimat is a 55-year-old married woman who has 4 family members from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to repaint her home and do maintenance on the kitchen. In the future she hopes to add a garden behind her home. Also, she hopes to add another floor for her son.

Due to cultural reasons, Ayat prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Ayat is a 21-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan who has two family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy ingredients for the project that she wants to develop making cheeses and yogurt to sell. In the future, Ayat hopes to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family's income. Since Ayat is under 30, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Muna is a 50-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan who has seven family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for her home improvements. Muna wants to do some home maintenance and to buy some household items. In the future, she would like to repaint her home and to buy new furniture.

Due to cultural reasons, Faten prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her mother. Faten is a 28-year-old woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who has two family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for her home improvements. \r\n\r\nFaten wants to do home maintenance and to buy new furniture: she also wants to do kitchen maintenance. In the future, she hopes to buy new electronic appliances and a new home, and also to decorate her new home.

Maysa is a 41-year-old married woman with five children who is from Al Zarqa in Jordan. She has requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. in the future, Maysa is planning to do further home improvements and to improve her family's living conditions.

Tagried is a 27-year-old married woman who has 2 family members from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 450 JOD to buy clothes for children and women to resell to her friends and neighbors. She wants to increase her product offering. In the future she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop and she wants to increase her family income.\r\n \r\nSince Tagried is under 30, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Najah is a 32-year-old married woman with two children who is from Al Aqaba in Jordan. She has requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for ingredients for making pastries so she can sell them. In the future, Najah is planning to expand her project by selling some grocery items and renting a small shop. Najah is looking forward to improving her family's living conditions.

Nadia is a 34-year-old married woman from Al-Hashmi, Amman, Jordan who has two family members. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to pay for her home improvements. Nadia wants to buy a refrigerator and electronic appliances. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment in which to live.

Gadier is a 39-year-old married woman who has 4 family members from Al Salt Al Balqa Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy clothes such as bridal gowns and dresses to resell to her friends and neighbors. She hopes to expand her project by opening a shop. She also hopes to increase her income to continue her sons' education.

Mary, who is in her early 40s, is married and lives together with her husband and two children (a boy and a girl) one who attends school while the other one has completed schooling.  Mary has been running her local restaurant (mama lishe) for four years now. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Mary used the previous loans to increase her charcoal stock by purchasing more sacks to sell, covering her household expenses, and she has successfully repaid all her loans.

Mary hopes for a loan to replace old items like plates and chairs in her mama lishe business in order to make the business attractive as well as to attract more customers. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group " Kagera" which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

Due to cultural reasons Zainab prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her daughter.\r\n\r\nZainab is a 51-year-old widow from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has 7 children and has requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for clothes and other goods to sell. In the future, Zainab is planning to expand her project and to have some salesmen working with her in order to increase income and improve the living conditions of her family.

Miasar is a 39-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan who has four family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements. Miasar wants to do home maintenance and to buy new furniture. She hopes in the future to improve her family's living standard.

Aysha is a 57-year-old married female from Ashrafia in Jordan. She has two children and requested a 800 JOD (Jordan dinar) loan to pay for clothes to sell. Aysha buys clothes and sells them to her neighbors. She is planning to increase her customers and employ some of her neighbors to work with her in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Muntaha is a 55 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for tuition university for her daughter she hopes for her daughter to continue her education. In the future she wants to improve her family living standard.

Khaled is a 37 year old married male from Jarash in Jordan. He has 4 children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for his home improvement and painting expenses. in the future, Khaled is planning to do further improvements.

Due to cultural reasons Rwida prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her father. Rwida is a 28 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements she would like to do maintenance of the home and to repainting her home. She hopes in the future to improve her family living standard.

Due to cultural reasons Nawal prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her brother.\r\n\r\nNawal is a 25 year old from Al Khaledieh in Jordan. she requested a 800 JOD loan to pay for buying clothes and selling them. in the future, Nawal is planning to open her own shop to increase income and improve the living conditions of her family.

Due to cultural reasons Kawthar prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Kawthar is a 35 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements she want to repainting her home and to do maintenance of the home. She hopes in the future to provide for her family a good environment to live in.

Yasmeen is a 47 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Jarsah Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 900 JD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to do maintenance of the home and to repainting her home. In the future she hopes to create a comfortable space and to improve her family living standard.

Asma is a 56 year old marrief female from Na'or in Jordan. She has 2 children and requested a 1500 JOD loan to pay for retailing in phone accessories and repaid mobile cards. In the future, Asma is planning to expand her project and have her own shop and also to increase income and improve the living conditions of her family.

Due to cultural reasons Areefah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son.\r\n\r\nAreefah is a 47 year old married female from Nao'or in Jordan. she has 4 children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for buying an egg hatchery. The second step of her project is to sell eggs weekly, and then to sell eggs on a daily bases. In the future, Areefah is planning to expand her project by buying another hatchery and selling eggs in a wider border.

Nemeh is a 47 year old married female from Sahab in Jordan. She has 10 children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her daughters educational expenses. In the future, Nemeh is planning to pay for her daughter's higher educational expenses and improve the living conditions of her family.

Wisam is a 24 year old married woman who has 1 family member from Madaba Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for her home improvements; she wants to buy a new furniture and some of households items. In the future she hopes to buy a new bed rooms and LCD screen to improve her family living standard.

Elmer is twenty-three years old and lives in the district of Santiago, an area that is characterized by farming and development, and in particular, the cultivation of cotton and grapes, among others.  Elmer is a hard-working man so that he can support his parents and their home expenses with the fruit of his labor.  

Elmer works as a moto-taxi driver.  He works about ten hours a day and can serve twenty customers daily.  He believes that his work is going well because he is kind to his customers and above all, he has a lot of drive to continue moving forward and to offer something better to his family.

Elmer is very thankful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to the help that has been offered to him, he will be able to cover the expenses to get his driver's license, since he was robbed and lost all of his documents.  He will be able to legally drive and continue fighting to be able to realize his biggest dream: "to finish building his house of higher-quality material."

Pedro is a 57-year-old single man who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago.  He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person with a strong desire to succeed.  Unfortunately, Pedro was not able to study for a professional career as, from a very young age, he had to work to help his parents with the household expenses.  In his free time he likes playing football with his friends and neighbours, and occasionally takes the opportunity to eat a delicious ceviche [a seafood dish] with his friends.

For a number of years Pedro has worked as a labourer on a farm in his city.  Every day, in the very early hours of the morning, he begins his work and can work for about 12 hours.  He believes that his business is going well due to his hard work, as he enjoys his job. 

Pedro is very grateful to Kiva lenders, as with the help he receives he will be able to make improvements to his home.  He wants to be able to finish off his bathroom by installing a toilet, painting and laying flooring.  This will mean that Pedro's home will be in a better, adequate, safe and healthy condition, which will improve his own and his family's well-being.

Diunieki is a 25-year-old young woman. She is single, does not have children and lives at her mother's house. She has been working in computer science at a government institution for the past 3 years. \r\n\r\nShe is requesting her first loan in order to buy materials such as sand, cement, cinder blocks, iron, wire, and to pay for labor, in order to tile and plaster the house. Thus, she will improve the house so it looks pretty and so that its walls last longer. In this way she will help her mother.

Young Brenda is single and doesn't have children. She has been working as a middle school teacher for the past ten years. She's a woman who loves teaching and sharing the gift of knowledge with local peasant children. She's someone who has struggled towards a better future. She requests her fifth loan in order to invest in the purchase of construction supplies so that she can build an addition to her house. Her biggest dream in life is improving her living conditions; having work stability in order to keep on making progress; being able to repay the loan; and seeing her family enjoy good health. With the loan she'll purchase cement, bricks, sand, iron and wire, and she'll pay for labor.

Fidel has three adult children. He was able to raise them with the support of his job as an accountant for a private business. However, over time, he began to work as a taxi driver and now has twenty years of experience with this work. His wife takes care of the home. Fidel is requesting this loan because he wants to put up a false ceiling in his home. Little by little, he works on repairing his home so his grandchildren can inherit it and remember him by it. With this loan, he will buy sheets of Plycem, a type of cement fiberboard, and materials for a doorframe.\n\nHis plan for the future is to open an eatery as a business instead of driving a taxi on the streets. He is tired of this work because it wears him out and, sometimes, it is dangerous.

Khadeja is a 26-year-old married woman with two family members. She is from Sahab, Jordan. \r\n\r\nKhadeja is requesting a 400 JOD loan to pay for home improvements such as buying new furniture and household items. In the future, she hopes to repaint her home to improve her family's living standards.

Raida is a 46-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan who has four family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She wants to do maintenance of the home and to repaint her home. She hopes in the future to expand her home and to buy new furniture.

Dua'a is a 28-year-old married woman from Al Karak, Jordan who has three family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture for the home to improve her family living standard. She hopes in the future to buy more furniture and some household items.

Kamilah is a 53-year-old married woman from Al Karak Jordan who has four family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements; she wants to buy new furniture and some household items. She hopes in the future to benefit from another loan to improve her family living standard.

Ahmad is a 22-year-old single male from Baqa'a in Jordan. He requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for his educational fees in university. Ahmad is in his last semester of his Bachelor's degree.  in the future, he is planning to take another loan to pay for his Master's degree fees.\r\n\r\nSince Ahmad is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

Fadwa is a 22-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan who has two family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy a new washing machine to improve her living standard. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment to live in.

Due to cultural reasons Marriam prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son. Marriam is a 40 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Bani Kenanah Irbid Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements; she wants to repaint her home and to buy new furniture and some household items. She hopes in the future to create a comfortable space.

Entesar is a 52 year old single female from Al Karak in Jordan. She has 3 children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for buying clothes and selling them to her neighbours. In the future, Entesar is planning to expand her project, and have her own shop in order to increase her income.

Hendia is a 35 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Bani Kenanah Irbid Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy a new furniture and some household items. She hopes in the future to improve her family living standard.

Due to cultural reasons Abeer prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Abeer is a 20 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Al Zarqa Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 JD to pay for her home improvements she would like to buy a new furniture and to do maintenance of the home. She wants in the future to improve her family living standard and to buy a washing machine.

Mohamad is a 26-year-old single male from Sahab in Jordan. he has two dependents and requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for his wedding expenses. In the future, Mohamad is planning to build a family, have children, and improve his living conditions.

Wafa is a 33 year old married female from Al Karak in Jordan. She requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses, and do some amendments and painting to the kitchen. In the future, Wafa is planning to paint the whole house and do further amendments.

Due to cultural reasons Haneen prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her mother.

Haneen is a 20 year old single female from Jarash in Jordan. she requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothes. Haneen is planning to expand her project and improve the living conditions of her family.

Since Haneen is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Muna is a 35 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 900 JD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy new furniture and some household items. She hopes in the future to improve her family living standard.

Shireen is a 27 year old married woman who has 1 family member, from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for blankets to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same area; she wants to increase her products. In the future she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop. \r\n\r\nSince Shireen is under 30 year old her loan is considered a youth loan.
Abd Al hadi is a 50-year-old married man from Jarash in Jordan. He has 6 children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for his home improvement expenses and to renew some furniture.

Due to cultural reasons Intisar prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son. Intisar is a 43 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements she would like to buy a new furniture and to do maintenance of the home. She hopes in the future to provide for her family a good environment to live in.

Shaher, age 50, is a married man who supports seven dependents in Jarash, Jordan. He has requested a 1,000 JOD loan, which he will use to pay for painting the family house. \r\n\r\nIn the future, Shaher is planning to do further renovations and repairs.

Dalal is a 35 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy clothes for women and children to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same of area she wants to increase her products. She hopes in the future to expand her project by open a shop.

Ali is a 38-year-old married male from Jarash in Jordan. He has five children and requested a 300 JOD loan to pay for his home improvement expenses and buy some furniture. In the future, Ali is planning to do further amendments.

Due to cultural reasons, Arwa prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Arwa is a 49-year-old married woman who has six family members; she comes from Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for materials for sewing such as a sewing machine, fabric, beads and silk to make clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. 

Arwa hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a sewing shop to increase her family income.

Due to cultural reasons Ala prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her father.

Ala. a 20-year-old married mother of one from Al Zarqa in Jordan, has requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for retailing in blankets. In the future, Ala is planning to open her own clothes shop and buy a house for her family.

Since Ala is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Ebtesam is a 46-year-old married female from Jarash in Jordan. She has seven children and requested a 300 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement and painting expenses. in the future, Ebtesam is planning to do further amendments.

Imtiaz is a 59-year-old married woman who has six family members; she comes from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to buy clothes for women and children to sell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She wants to expand her project. She hopes in the future to buy a new home.
Ahmad is a 31-year-old engaged male from Jarash in Jordan. He has five dependents and requested a 1500 JOD loan to pay for his wedding expenses.

Tareq is a 25-year-old married man who has 2 family members from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for home improvements. He would like to repaint his home and buy new furniture. He hopes to provide a good environment for his family to live in.

Due to cultural reasons, Fatemah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.\r\n\r\nFatemah is a 51-year-old married female from Bani Kenanah in Jordan. She has six children and requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for retailing grocery items, nuts, and cleaning supplies. In the future, Fatemah is planning to expand her project and buy some shelves for the goods and do some painting for the place she is working from. As a second step, Fatemah wants to widen the variety of goods in order to increase income and improve her living conditions.

Due to cultural reasons, Nahla prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.\r\n\r\nNahla is a 42-year-old married female from Al Koorah in Jordan. She has four children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and buy some furniture. In the future, Nahla is planning to do some extensions to her house.

Tghreed is a 25-year-old married female from Al Karak in Jordan. She has 2 children and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home's improvement expenses and to buy some houseware tools. Tghreed needs to buy a freezer. In the future, she is planning to improve the living conditions of her family.

Soad is a 43-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan who has 12 family members. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do maintenance of the kitchen and bathroom and to do decorating to improve her living standard. She hopes in the future to expand her home and she is planning on adding another room in her home.

Ekhlas is a 40-year-old married female from Al Karak in Jordan. She requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for buying the tools and materials needed to work in ceramics. In the future, Ekhlas is planning to expand her project to include several hand-made productions in order to increase income and improve the living conditions of her family.

Due to cultural reasons, Kafa prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.\r\n\r\nKafa is a 53-year-old married female from Al Koorah in Jordan. She has a child and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home's improvement expenses and to buy some furniture, like a closet and a fridge. In the future, Kafa is planning to build an additional room.

Due to cultural reasons, Wejdan prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.\r\n\r\nWejdan is a 40-year-old married female from Al Koorah in Jordan. She has a child and requested a 1000 JOD loan to pay for her clothing and sewing business. Wejdan is planning to buy a sewing machine. In the future, she wants to buy more machines and open her own shop.

Sherihan is a 27-year-old single female from Marka in Jordan. She requested an 800 JOD loan to pay for retailing in clothes and blankets, and selling them to the neighbours. In the future, Sherihan is planning to buy a car and a house.\r\n\r\nSince Sherihan is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Rasha is a 24-year-old married woman who has two family members; she comes from Al Karak, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements;she would like to buy new furniture and to repaint her home. She hopes in the future to buy more furniture and some household items to improve her family living standard.

Sobeyda, a resident of zone 2 of Nueva Guinea, is married, and the mother of a child. She also works as a teacher for a school. 

She is requesting her first loan in order to make improvements on her home. Therefore, to build a bedroom in her house she needs to buy sand, cement, cinder blocks, iron, and gravel, and pay for labor. Her main goal is to have better conditions in her home. Sobeyda has demonstrated ability and willingness to repay. She is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva. 

Her biggest dream is to have a beautiful and pleasant home, which will make her feel better.

Andrés is 26 years old, he is married with Cinthia and they have a 8-year-old son. Andrés is a very resourceful and hardworking person, and he is currently asking for his fourth loan to our institution to enlarge his house. He and his wife work for the same "maquiladora" (a bonded assembly plant set up by a foreign firm near the US border), and he says he likes working there because of the benefits. He is also a blacksmith, and in the evenings he works in his workshop set in his house, producing all kinds of items such as doors and protections for windows. Andrés hopes to continue counting on the loans.

Raul is 28 years old, he is married with Rocio and they have 2 children who attend primary school.\nHe is currently asking for his second loan because he needs to invest it in his grocery store because he is very low on merchandise.  With this loan he will supply the store, and therefore be able to cover all the needs of his clients.  He and his wife run the shop at different times of day because he has a second job. Raul is deeply grateful for the support he has received.  With the sales from his store he will be able to pay back the loan, and with his salary from his other job he pays for household expenses and his children's school.

Natividad is 44 years old, he has been a taxi driver for 12 years, and he has his own taxi license.\r\nHe is currently asking for his fifth loan to our institution: he will use it to renew and pay for said license. This is an extra earning for him on top of his wife’s activity: Rosa, his wife, works on her own selling clothes. No one is economically dependent on them, as their children are already married and have houses of their own. However, Natividad and his wife live in his elderly parents’ house, as his mother is losing her eyesight. He wishes to continue counting on Kiva’s support.

This group was created in June 2009. It consists of members who are all from the same zone, and they are in business as shopkeepers.

The one who is in the back on the photo and raising her left arm is the featured borrower. She is 47 years old, she is married and mother to 4 children.

Her business consists in buying wood to resell. She has good experience for this type of business because she has practiced it for a long time.

With this loan she plans to buy wood to resell it.

Her goal is to provide for her children's schooling and health.

Yohima del Rosario is a 26-year-old single mother who lives in zone 5 of Nueva Guinea.  She is a merchant and has her own business where she has gotten ahead all on her own.  

This is her third loan, which she needs in order to make some home improvements. In this case, she will be making improvements to her bedroom.  She will need to buy cement, sand, concrete block, gravel, iron, and wiring as well as pay for labor.  These improvements will provide better living conditions and a better quality of life for her two school-aged children.  

She is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva because she has prospered and increased her family’s income.

Sofia is 62 and married. Her children are adults now and they help with the household expenses. \r\n\r\nShe is a small farmer in the area where she lives and is requesting a second loan from Afodenic in order to plant 4 manzanas [6.8 acres] of corn, for which she needs to buy supplies and fertilizers to achieve this goal. It is important to note that Sofia has plenty of experience in the field and has the support of her husband who helps her out in the fields.

Marvin is 40 years old and is single. He is a small farmer in the area where he lives. He is requesting his second loan, which he will use to buy four calves of 200 kgs each. He will rear these calves until they are a good size and weight, then he will sell them at a price that will earn him a good profit.\r\n\r\nHis biggest dream is to see his herd grow strong so that he can leave his children a good inheritance that they can work in order to have a good life.

Felipe, 43 years old, is married. His family includes his wife and their three children; the oldest is 12 years old, another is 8 years old, and the youngest is 4 years old. They are all in school. His wife is in charge of caring for them, completing the household chores, and helping Felipe with some of the outdoor work. Felipe is a small farmer on his area of land. \r\n\r\nHe is requesting his second loan to buy a calf, with which he will have additional income from milk production. His greatest desire and goal is to increase his cattle herd so he can leave them with his children. This way, they will have secure jobs to work at so they can move forward and have the necessities in life.

Sra. Rosalia, 43, is married and has one son.  Her son is in high school and her husband operates an auto repair business from a workshop behind their house.  Rosalia has worked as a technician for a private company for 24 years.  She is applying for a loan, her fourth, that she will use to make improvements to her house.  The investment will allow her to buy the building materials--roofing, perlines, cement, concrete blocks, sand, iron bar--she needs for the project.  Rosalia is a responsible woman and she has made significant improvements to her house with past loans.  Her goal is to improve the house, bit by bit, and make it a safer, more attractive place for her family to live.

Ket is 53 years old and a determined mother of four children: two married children and two single children. Ket devotes her full attention to a rice farming business to provide enough sustenance for her family. Since she was a widowed woman, she has tried harder in her current business to help the two younger children in their education. Despite the hardships, Ket aims to have them finished their high school level. Ket is happy that her married children usually send a small remittance home each month to support the family financially each month.\r\n\r\nWith this loan amount, Ket would like to purchase a motorcycle which will be used to support as transportation for both household use and business. This loan will help some of her children in travelling to their workplaces and reduce the expenses on transportation costs. Someday, Ket would like to keep growing her farming business during her entrepreneurship and help her children in their education.

Phuong, 37 years old, is married with three school-aged children. Phuong is in the construction business in mobile places as the family’s main source of income. Phuong untiringly earns income because he is determined to uplift his family out of poverty and educate all of his children. Phuong is proud of his wife who is very supportive in raising the family. She has a position in a local garment factory of Kompong Speu province. \r\n\r\nPhuong has encountered difficulties due to the lack of a vehicle for commuting, especially to his workplaces. For this reason, he is now asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for traveling to construction sites. Also, Phuong plans to use it as a transportation business in his community during his unemployed periods. This will help better his income and develop his business gradually. In the future, Phuong would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur and save money for family emergencies.

Say is a 60-year-old married woman who has been living in Kompong Speu province of Cambodia. She is a mother of nine children, currently five of whom are married and some of the rest children are employed to support the family financially. Say and her spouse has been a farmer for long time ago. They cultivate and harvest rice in each season for their daily food.\r\n\r\nSay is requesting a loan through HKL because she wants to make improvements in her business. She will purchase a cow for farming purpose. With the help of the loan, Say is convinced that she will be able to reduce operating cost partially and make her business more viable. In the future, Say is going to save a portion of her profit for the expansion of her farming business.

In is a widowed woman who has no children for her life but she is a proud farmer who manages one hectare and a half of farmland where she usually grows rice each rainy season. In, at 46, has worked very hard in order to maintain a good business as well as her living status. In is a resident of Kompong Speu province, Cambodia.\r\n\r\nAt the moment, In is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD through HKL and Kiva lenders. With this loan, she will be able to prepare a religious ceremony for her parents who passed away. For most Cambodian people, this celebration is meaningful and is to show gratefulness to their dead parents and ancestors who did good deeds over their lives. She hopes that this loan will be granted to her for the above-mentioned purpose.

Hing is 58 years old and a retired policeman who always helps his wife manage their farm and take care of the family that is comprised of six children. Five of them are already married and have independent lives. Hing is thankful to his wife who has helped him in every situation to better their family economically since the beginning. That is why he is very supportive and a hardworking father for the household.\r\n\r\nNow Hing is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to invest in their farming business effectively. Through using the loan, he will be able to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the operating costs in farming. Hopefully, he will have a fruitful harvest in the coming season. In the future, he wishes to own extra lots of farmland and increase his production.

Khat is 51 years old and a mother of four children. She is a low-income woman who pays her full devotion to her farming business in Kompong Speu province. She has worked in this field with the help of her spouse and children. Financial constraints on the family prevented all her children from attending school. And recently, all of them are employed by a local garment factory to boost the household income and satisfy their living needs.\r\n\r\nThe purpose of the loan is to buy a motorcycle which will be used by her children for commuting to their workplaces. Khat mentioned that this will help them to cut down their daily expenses on transportation costs so that they can save more money for other purposes.
