She is glad and grateful for the constant help from Kiva lenders. She promises to pay her loan back punctually as scheduled.

Chhoem, aged 53, is a resident living with his family in Kompong Speu province. He pursues rice farming as his focused business, from which he is able to generate a decent income to raise his family. His wife has a position in a local market to add to his income. Together, they are responsible for six children. Four of them are married and the rest two are ready for high school. Chhoem realizes that he will need more funds to support his children’s education at their high school level, so he would like to be involved in animal trading business to supplement his income.\r\n\r\nDue to insufficient capital, Chhoem is taking out a loan in the amount of 600 USD to purchase animals for sale.  He hopes that he would have better revenue through the investment in animal-sale business and he will be able to further support his children’s education so that they might have a bright future. He is very thankful for the help of the loan and promises to use it wisely.

Chak is 53 years old, married and a rural villager from Kompong Speu province. She has four children – a married son and three single children who still depend on her income and help her in farming business. Chaks owns and manages one hectare and half of paddy field to make a livelihood while her husband operates a medium oven for making charcoal and supplies in his neighborhood. \r\n\r\nChak has been with HKL for one loan and has already successfully repaid the previous loan. She used the loan to sustain her farming business. In the same manner, Chak is applying for a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase an extra plot of farmland to expand her rice production. She hopes for better yields and profit so that she will be able to upgrade her living conditions.

Ung is a 50-year-old married woman who has five children. Ung works hard at the rice field every day to generate income, which she usually uses to cover her daily costs, especially food. She has been in this business for over 30 years and it has become the primary source of income for the family. In the past few years, all of her children quit studying due to the family’s financial difficulties and they have been employed in various jobs to help the entire family ever since. Two of them work as garment workers while some of the rest help their parents in cultivating rice and raising poultry.\r\n\r\nUng is concerned about her children’s safety because they don’t have their own vehicle for commuting to their workplaces. They usually use motorcycle transportation service and thus have to spend money on transportation costs daily. In order to help them to own a motorcycle, Ung would like to request a loan through HKL and Kiva to purchase one for their commute. She hopes that Kiva lenders won't reject her loan and she thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

Heow is 38 years old, single and lives with his brother and sister in Kompong Speu province. He has been operating a small farm to generate income for his family, while his younger brother owns a small barbershop in their village and serves local people with his hair removal service. To financially help the family, his youngest sister is also employed in a local garment factory. Together, they always help each other with their generated income.\r\n\r\nIn the past two years, Heow attended a vocational training school at Phnom Penh city in the field of generator mechanics. In regard to this, he is taking out this loan to pay back the cost of his course of study and a certificate. He realizes that he will be able to provide this type of service in his neighborhood if he could find a good location and have enough capital to establish his own business. He hopes that his dream will come true someday and he will save a portion of his profit toward achieving his dream.

Chak is a humble villager from Kompong Speu province’s Chbar Mon district. She is 47 years old and a widow with five children. Her oldest child is married already while the remaining are single and help her both in farming and a retail business. Aside from farming activities, Chak operates a retail store in a local market, selling kitchen supplies such as plates, bowls, spoons, forks, frying pan and pots. She has been engaged in her business for almost 20 years and earns approximately 24,000 KHR per day.\r\n\r\nChak would like to expand her business and have more customers using her products. That’s why she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to invest in her retail business. She will use a portion of the loan to purchase a trailer for loading a large quantity of her merchandise.  From the trailer, those of her children will be able to sell more products from place to place and this will increase their profit. Also, she will buy stock of her inventory with the remaining funds. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions as she and her children strive to work hard.

Ros is 37 years old and a resident from Dongkor district, Phnom Penh. He is married with two children. Ros and his wife help each other in raising and educating their children. He earns his income from a mechanical repair business, while his wife has a business position in the market selling fast food. He operates his business far away from his home, in a public gathering where there are more travelers passing his repair shop. He has been in this field for more than six years and typically makes around 5 USD per day.\r\n\r\nRos decided to look for a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase a motorcycle for commuting. Currently, Ros often gets a taxi service and pays for the costs every day. He hopes that this vehicle will enable him to save more profits for his family and help him in his transportation needs. He would be grateful if he could have financial support from lenders.

A married mother of six children, Sokhen is 58 years old and a local farmer originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has managed her five hectares of farmland with her husband to grow rice. She has been engaged in this business for ten years and is able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. \r\n\r\nSokhen has been with VisionFund for the past three cycles. She has used her past loans with success in upgrading her living conditions to being better than before, and has fully paid back the loans already. Now, she is the leader of the group consisting of three female members. The total amount of this group is 1,600,000 KHR. For Sokhen's portion, in the amount of 500,000 KHR, she will use it to purchase fertilizer and gasoline for her rice farm. She hopes that this purchase will help her to grow her rice on time and provide her with a good yield. Hence, she can generate more income better than before in order to sustain her living conditions.

Thorn is 64 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom (a daughter) still depends on her and is currently helping with the household chores. Thorn's residential area is in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, where rice farming is the common business in her neighborhood as well as for Thorn. She and her husband do rice cropping on three hectares of farmland, which she has been engaged in for ten years and is able to earn almost 15,000 KHR. \r\n\r\nThorn's past loan was her original loan. The prior loan, which she has paid back with success, has provided sufficient working capital to support her business and improve her lifestyle. Now, she has formed a group of four female members. She is in the second cycle loan and her remaining three members are in the first cycle loan. All of them are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Thorn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes to obtain more crop yields with a good profit so she can keep her good standards of living.

Safa'a is a 32-year-old married woman who has one family member and lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JOD to help her pay for home improvements. Safa'a would like to buy new furniture for her living room. In addition, she hopes that in the future, she would be able to benefit from another loan and buy bedroom furniture.

Due to cultural reasons, Maison prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. \r\n\r\nMaison is a 40-year-old married woman who has four family members from Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy household items to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area she wants to increase her products. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop.

For cultural reasons, Feda'a prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her brother. 

Feda'a is a 29-year-old married woman with one family member from Jarash Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of JD 400 to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to repaint her home and to do other maintenance. She hopes in the future to improve her family's living standards.

Amenah is a 44-year-old married woman who has eight family members from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD (Jordan dinar) to pay for her home improvements: She would like to do maintenance of the home and buy new furniture. She hopes in the future to provide a good environment to live in.

Due to cultural reasons, Khadeja prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her son. Khadeja is a 48-year-old married woman who has seven family members from Madaba, Jordan. \r\n\r\nShe is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD (Jordan dinar) to buy dishes and communication equipment to resell. She would like to increase her products. She hopes in the future to expand her shop and to decorate.

Manal is a 29-year-old married woman from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy clothes for women and children to resell to her friends and neighbors and so that she can increase her products. In the future, she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop to display her products to increase her income. Since Manal is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Waed is a 23-years-old married woman who has 2 family members and is from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy materials for sewing. She plans to purchase a sewing machine, fabric, silk and beads to make a clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors. She wants to expand her business in the future. \r\n\r\nSince Waed is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Due to cultural reasons, Fayedah asked that her photo not be on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her son.\r\n\r\nFayedah is a 52-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan. She has 6 children and requested a 800 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and to buy some furniture. In the future, Fayedah is planning to improve the living conditions of her family.

Jameelah is a 59-years-old widow from Baqa'a in Jordan. She has 3 children and has requested a 1000 JOD loan to pay for clothes to sell. In the future, Jameelah is planning to participate in some exhibitions, or open her own shop, in order to expand her project and increase her sales income. Jameelah would like to buy a car and build a house.

Lenaa is a 38-year-old married woman from Irbid Jordan who has 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 JOD to buy clothes for women and children to resell and she wants to buy materials for making clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop to display her products and to increase her family income.

Waed is a 22-year-old married woman with two family members who lives in Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for home improvements. Waed wants to use the loan to purchase a new television and undertake general home maintenance. In the future, she would like to repaint some of the rooms as well as the kitchen area in her home. Overall, Waed wants to improve her family`s living standard. \r\n\r\nDue to cultural reasons Waed prefers that her photograph does not get posted online. Therefore, the photograph posted with this loan profile is of her husband.

Due to cultural reasons, Jumana prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.\r\n\r\nJumana is a 25-year-old married female from Jarash in Jordan. She has two children and requested a 500 JOD (Jordan dinar) loan to pay for her home-improvement and painting expenses. In the future, Jumana is planning to do further amendments to improve the living conditions of her family.

Due to cultural reasons, Rahmeh prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Rahmeh is a 36-year-old married woman who has three family members from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. \r\n\r\nShe is requesting a loan of 600 JD (Jordan dinar) to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy a new television and oven and new electronic appliances. She hopes in the future to benefit from another loan to buy new furniture.
Shafa is a 37-years-old married female from Jarash in Jordan. She has 4 children and has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses.

Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man from Jarash, Jordan. He is requesting a 800 JOD loan in order to allow him to pay for his home improvement expenses and buy furniture. In the future, Mohammad is also planning to undertake further home improvements.

Nuha is a 56-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal, Jordan. She is requesting a 1000 JOD loan to buy cooking supplies and ingredients for pasty making. Nuha intends on increasing her income by selling the pastries to friends and neighbors, who live in the same of area as her. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by opening a shop. As well, Nuha hopes to buy a new home.

Hanan is a 23-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy women`s and children`s clothing and accessories. Hanan is planning to resell the clothing and accessories to her friends and neighbors who live in the same of area as her. She wants to develop this business in order to increase her income. In the future Hanan hopes to buy a car and a home. \r\n\r\nDue to cultural reasons, Hanan prefers that her photograph is not posted online. Therefore, the photograph associated with this profile is of her father. According to the Field Partner, since Hanan is under the age of 30, this loan is considered a youth loan.

Mustafa is a 26-year-old engaged man. He is requesting a 1000 JOD loan to allow him to pay for his wedding expenses and to buy furniture. In the future, Mustafa is planing on building a family with good living conditions.

Marwan is a 45-year-old married man who has five family members from Al Aqaba, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy materials for making Oriental antiques because he wants to increase the number of products he can resell. He hopes in the future to expand his project by opening a shop to increase his income. \nIn the picture Marwan is the man on the right and his friend is standing next to him on the left.

Wedad is a 51-year-old married woman with four children from Al Karak, Jordan. She is requesting a 600 JOD loan in order to allow her to buy additional used clothing for resale. Wedad buys used clothing from Kuwait and then sells it. In the future, she is planning to start retailing used furniture, in order to further improve the living conditions of her family.

Due to cultural reasons Dina prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her mother. Dina is a 24-year-old single woman from Al Khaldieh in Al Mafraq, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy household items to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. She wants to increase her products. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family income.

Najeha is a 37-year-old married woman with two children from Al Salt, Jordan. She is requesting a 300 JOD loan to allow her to pay for her home improvement expenses. Najeha is planning on building additional rooms in her house, in order to further improve the living conditions of her family.

Due to cultural reasons, Nabiela prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her son. \r\n\r\nNabiela is a 50-year-old married woman form Al Koorah, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy household items to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area where she wants to increase her products. In the future, she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop.

Areej is a 25-year-old married woman from Jarash in Jordan. She has four children and requested a 600 Jordanian dinar (JOD) loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and buy some furniture. In the future, Areej is planning to do further improvements.

Nahla is a 35-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 Jordanian dinars to pay for home improvements. She would like to do maintenance on her home and she wants to buy windows. She hopes to provide a good environment to live in.

Noor is a 27-year-old married woman from Jarash, Jordan, who has three family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to pay for home improvements. She wants to do maintenance on her home and buy new furniture for the home to improve her family's standard of living. She hopes to benefit from another loan in the future.\r\n\r\nFor cultural reasons, Noor prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the photo is of her husband.
